0.title: Who is Radhika Merchant, Mukesh & Nita Ambani's son Anant's fiancee?
0.article_body: Mukesh and Nita Ambani on Sunday hosted an Arangetram event for Radhika Merchant, who is engaged to their son Anant Ambani. She is the daughter of billionaire Viren Merchant, the CEO of the pharma company Encore Healthcare. She studied politics and economics during her undergraduate from New York University and completed her Bharatanatyam training under Guru Bhavana Thakar.

1.title: This happens in our industry: Kuku on extra-marital affair with Aruna
1.article_body: Director-producer Sandeep Kohli, known as Kuku Kohli, has spoken about his extra-marital affair with veteran actress Aruna Irani, saying that such things happen in the industry. He added that the two live together. On being asked if his daughters have accepted the veteran actress as family, he said, "Aisa kabhi mauka hi nahi aaya (The opportunity never came up only)."

2.title: It's like he came to say goodbye: Gulzar on KK's last recorded song
2.article_body: After late singer KK's last recorded song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' was released, veteran lyricist Gulzar said, "It's like he came to say goodbye." Gulzar further said, "When he came to sing the song for 'Sherdil', it filled my heart with joy. It's a shame that this had to go down as one of his last songs."

3.title: Been tough 2 weeks but also exhilarating: Nadal on 14th French Open win
3.article_body: Reflecting on the past two weeks in Paris following his record-extending 14th French Open title, world number four Rafael Nadal said it has been "tough", but it's also been very "exhilarating". He added, "Very pleased, obviously. I'm happy...And I'll be leaving here with an unforgettable memory." Overall, it was Nadal's 22nd Grand Slam title win on Sunday.

4.title: Russian authorities put investigative journalist on wanted list
4.article_body: Investigative journalist Andrei Soldatov on Monday said that Russian authorities had placed him on a wanted list and frozen his bank accounts. Soldatov is known for his coverage of Russian security agencies. Soldatov claimed the case against him had been filed in a manner similar to that of two journalists accused of spreading "fake information" about Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

5.title: I'm silent, not sick: Dharmendra in video refuting hospitalisation rumours
5.article_body: Actor Dharmendra shared a video denying rumours of him being hospitalised in a 'critical' condition as was reported earlier. "Main chup hu, lekin beemaar nahi (I'm silent but not sick)," said the 86-year-old veteran actor. "Be positive, think positive, life will be positive," said Dharmendra in the video. He was hospitalised last month following a muscle spasm.

6.title: Man kills wife, daughters aged 2 & 3 with stone in Rajasthan
6.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his wife and two daughters, aged two and three years, by hitting them with a heavy stone after a domestic issue at a village in Rajasthan's Udaipur district. The man then ran away, police said. The couple's eight-year-old son was also present on the spot and he rushed to his grandparents' house to inform them.

7.title: I had to do Deepika's 'Bajirao Mastani' scene in audition: Manushi
7.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar has said that she was given a scene from actress Deepika Padukone's 2015 film 'Bajirao Mastani' for her audition. She called the audition "most intense and challenging", adding that the call after the audition confirming her role was validation that she could chase her dreams in Bollywood. Manushi made her Bollywood debut in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj'.

8.title: NATO kicks off drills with Finland, Sweden amid tensions with Russia
8.article_body: NATO on Sunday kicked off a two-week military exercise with Finland and Sweden in the Baltic Sea amid tensions with Russia over the war in Ukraine. Notably, Finland and Sweden had applied to join NATO in May. Russia had warned the two countries against joining the Western military alliance and warned them of retaliatory measures against the move.

9.title: Happy to see how my nephew Nadal is totally normal guy despite success: Toni
9.article_body: Praising nephew Rafael Nadal, his uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said he's happy to see how the 36-year-old is a "totally normal guy", who plays good tennis and hasn't changed despite having a successful career. Nadal recently won his 22nd Grand Slam title, an all-time men's record, at French Open. Toni is currently part of Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime's coaching team.

10.title: Delhi law student held for intentionally hitting biker with Scorpio car
10.article_body: A 25-year-old final-year law student from Delhi has been arrested after a video purportedly showed him speeding away after hitting a 22-year-old biker with his Scorpio car. The biker has claimed that the accused, who got into an argument with him, verbally abused and threatened him before intentionally hitting his bike. The law student's car has been seized.

11.title: Jailed leader Navjot Singh Sidhu hospitalised due to liver problems
11.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was lodged in Patiala central jail, has been hospitalised due to liver-related problems, Chandigarh's PGIMER said. The hospital said that he required further evaluation and his condition is stable. Sidhu was last month sentenced to one year in jail over a 1988 road rage case that led to a man's death.

12.title: Fire at container depot in Bangladesh continues for 3rd day
12.article_body: A fire that left 41 people dead at a container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong has continued to burn for the third day on Monday. Officials warned that there is a risk of further blasts if the flames spread to chemicals stored nearby. An official said that a container with hydrogen peroxide was identified as the possible source of the fire.

13.title: Will finish my term, won't run for re-election: Sri Lankan Prez
13.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said that he will complete the remaining two years of his term but won't contest again, Bloomberg reported. "I can't go as a failed president...I have been given a mandate for five years," he said. His comments come as anti-government protesters have been demanding his ouster amid country's worst economic crisis since independence.

14.title: Teenage MP girl, uncle paraded with garlands of shoes for eloping; 8 held
14.article_body: A 17-year-old girl and her 48-year-old maternal uncle were allegedly abused and paraded with garlands of shoes around their necks in a village in Madhya Pradesh as punishment for eloping, police said. A case was registered and eight persons were arrested in this connection. The villagers allegedly abused the duo for the "immoral" act, police added, while quoting the FIR.

15.title: I started doing wicketkeeping as my father was a wicketkeeper too: Pant
15.article_body: Revealing how he became a wicketkeeper-batter, Rishabh Pant said, "As a kid, I started doing wicketkeeping because my father was a wicketkeeper too." The India wicketkeeper-batter added, "I have no idea if my wicketkeeping has got better or not, I am just trying to give my 100 percent every single day. I was always a wicketkeeper-batter."

16.title: Brazil begins talks with IAEA on nuclear fuel for planned submarine
16.article_body: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) chief Rafael Grossi on Monday said that Brazil has initiated discussions with the UN watchdog aimed at eventually allowing it to use nuclear fuel in a submarine. Brazil plans to acquire a nuclear-powered submarine under a contract with a French company. Notably, nuclear-powered submarines can remain underwater and at sea for longer than other submarines.

17.title: Nuclear-capable ballistic missile Agni-4 successfully tested from Odisha
17.article_body: India successfully carried out a training launch of nuclear-capable intermediate-range ballistic missile Agni-4 from Odisha's APJ Abdul Kalam Island on Monday, the Defence Ministry said. "The successful test reaffirms India's policy of having a credible minimum deterrence capability," it added. The test is part of routine user training launches carried out under Strategic Forces Command's aegis.

18.title: Want to inculcate Dhoni's calmness, self-belief: SA all-rounder Pretorius
18.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa five-match T20I series, South Africa all-rounder Dwaine Pretorius said he'll try to bring MS Dhoni's calmness and self-belief into his game. Pretorius made his IPL debut for Dhoni-led CSK this year. On the upcoming series, Pretorius said, "Performances in this series is going to go far to secure a spot in the [T20] World Cup."

19.title: Why is UK PM Johnson facing a no-confidence vote today?
19.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson faces a no-confidence vote in the Parliament on Monday over the 'partygate' scandal. A video of Johnson's senior aides joking about breaking lockdown rules to attend a Christmas party was leaked online in December 2021. Parties involving alcohol were allegedly held in Downing Street during the height of COVID-19 lockdowns in 2020 and 2021.

20.title: England Test captaincy had become very unhealthy relationship: Root
20.article_body: Speaking about England Test captaincy, Joe Root stated it had become a "very unhealthy relationship", adding it was taking a bad toll on his personal health. "I couldn't leave it at...ground any more; it was coming home," Root said. Root, who was replaced by Ben Stokes, led England in 64 Tests, winning 27 and losing 26 during his five-year tenure.

21.title: 20-year-old man arrested for 'needle attacks' in France
21.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested in southern France on Sunday after being accused of attacking people with needles. The accused was charged two days after 20 people reported needle injuries during the filming of a televised concert in Toulon. As many as 100 incidents of 'needle injuries' at French nightclubs and festivals have been reported since beginning of this year.

22.title: It's time to send an IAS officer to jail: High Court on officials not obeying orders
22.article_body: Karnataka High Court expressed displeasure over government officials not following court orders and observed, "It's time an IAS officer is sent to jail." It also observed that officers were not taking court orders seriously. The court said this after the state government failed to implement a July, 2021 court order regarding merging of Group-C with Group-B jobs in municipalities.

23.title: I was asked to have no expression for passport photo: Shabana Azmi
23.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar on Monday shared a picture of himself smiling on social media along with the caption, "Too smiley for a passport photo I was told." His step-mother veteran actress Shabana Azmi commented on the post, writing, "I was asked to have no expression for my passport photo and replied I'm an actress I can't be expressionless!!!"

24.title: Sri Lankan minister convicted of extortion, gets suspended sentence
24.article_body: Sri Lankan Cabinet minister Prasanna Ranatunga has been convicted of extorting money from a businessman over a land deal on Monday. Ranatunga, the younger brother of Sri Lankan cricketer Arjuna Ranatunga, was given two-year suspended prison sentence and fined 25 million Sri Lankan rupees. He was asked to pay one million Sri Lankan rupees as compensation to the businessman.

25.title: China's Beijing reopens restaurants amid declining COVID-19 cases
25.article_body: Beijing on Monday reopened restaurants for the first time in over a month amid declining COVID-19 cases in China's national capital. Museums, cinemas and gyms will be allowed to operate at up to 75% of capacity and delivery drivers will be able to bring packages to a customer's door. Authorities had conducted multiple rounds of mass testing during the outbreak.

26.title: Scorpio driver who hit biker & ran away in Delhi booked
26.article_body: The driver of the Mahindra Scorpio who rammed the car into a biker in South Delhi's Arjan Garh has been booked, police said.  A video of the car hitting the biker and speeding away went viral on social media on Sunday. The biker alleged that the driver verbally abused and threatened him before hitting the bike.

27.title: Anupam Kher meets UP CM Yogi Adityanath at his residence, shares pics
27.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher met Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath at his official residence in Lucknow and shared pictures from the meeting on social media on Monday. The actor wrote, "The stories of your early life were very entertaining and interesting as well as inspiring. You are a source of energy for us and for every generation of the country."

28.title: 'Do you use makeup', journalist asks world No 1 Iga after French Open, fans react
28.article_body: World No 1 tennis player Iga Swiatek was asked by a journalist, "When you go to a party, do you use makeup?" after Swiatek clinched her second French Open title. She replied, "I don't wear makeup...I don't feel like I...have to." A fan said, "The reporter...should be banned from WTA events". "Can't wait to hear Rafa's answer," said another.

29.title: DNA test ordered on 'stolen' buffalo to settle ownership fight in UP
29.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli has ordered a buffalo's DNA test after a labourer, who complained that the animal was stolen from his shed in 2020, traced it to another village. The alleged new owner claimed the buffalo belongs to him. Shamli SP said the test was ordered as the labourer claimed to have the buffalo's mother in his possession.

30.title: UAE condemns ex-BJP leader's remarks against Prophet, says 'respect religious symbols'
30.article_body: The UAE on Monday released a statement, condemning former BJP leader's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "The Ministry underscored the need to respect religious symbols and not violate them, as well as confront hate speech and violence," the UAE's Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation stated. BJP had suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal over their remarks.

31.title: We condemn offensive statements by BJP official against Prophet: Oman to India
31.article_body: Oman has released a statement saying that it summoned Indian ambassador and "expressing to him the Sultanate of Oman's condemnation of the offensive statements of the Prophet...issued by a BJP official". It also welcomed BJP's decision to suspend the BJP leader. Earlier, Qatar, Iran and Kuwait summoned the Indian envoy over the remarks.

32.title: My happiness won't change 1% if Novak wins 23 Slams and I stay at 22: Nadal
32.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal, who won his 22nd Grand Slam at recently concluded French Open, said he won't be bothered if Novak Djokovic wins 23 Slams and he stays at 22. "My happiness will not change at all. Not even one percent," he added. Nadal further said that breaking his tally of 14 French Open titles will be "difficult".

33.title: 90% of land acquisition for bullet train project completed: NHSRCL
33.article_body: National High Speed Rail Corporation Limited (NHSRCL) on Monday said that over 90% of the land required for the Ahmedabad-Mumbai bullet train project has been acquired. NHSRCL also said that 98.79% of the land required in Gujarat has been acquired, while the figure stands at 71.49% in Maharashtra. The land required in Dadra and Nagar Haveli has been fully acquired.

34.title: Maybe I'll take prince: Kartik Aaryan on being called 'king' like SRK
34.article_body: On being called 'king of monologues' and 'king of masses' when only Shah Rukh Khan holds the title 'King of Bollywood', Kartik Aaryan said, "Maybe I'll take prince." The actor further said he doesn't want to accept the term 'king' since he still has a long way to go. "I think I'm just happy with all the love," he added.

35.title: Sable breaks national record in 3000m steeplechase for 8th time in Rabat
35.article_body: India's Avinash Sable broke his own 3000m steeplechase national record after he finished fifth in the race at Rabat Diamond League 2022 in Morocco on Sunday. The 27-year-old, in his maiden Diamond League appearance, clocked 8:12.48. This is the eighth time Sable broke the national record. Tokyo Olympic gold medallist Soufiane El Bakkali of Morocco won the race in 7:58.28.

36.title: China bans tattoos for minors, says they oppose 'socialist values'
36.article_body: China on Monday banned individuals aged below 18 from getting tattoos, stating that body art for minors opposes "socialist core values". According to the new rules, tattoo artists and parlours found to be tattooing minors will be strictly punished as per law. Additionally, no advertisement, books, journals or digital publications can include content that could influence minors to get tattoos.

37.title: Mumbai's daily COVID-19 cases fall to 676; positivity rate at 9.8%
37.article_body: Mumbai on Monday reported 676 new COVID-19 cases, compared to 961 cases recorded on Sunday. The positivity rate dropped to 9.8% from Sunday's 10.94%. The city saw 318 recoveries in the last 24 hours, while the number of active cases stands at 5,238. The overall growth rate of COVID-19 cases in Mumbai between May 30 and June 5 was 0.066%.

38.title: Amber gets proposal from Saudi man, he says he's better than Depp
38.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has received a marriage proposal from a Saudi Arabian man after losing the defamation trial by ex-husband Johnny Depp. The man says in a voice note sent to Amber's Instagram account, "You have no one except me to take care of you...some people hate and bully you...[I've] decided to marry you...I'm better than that old man (Depp)."

39.title: Lawrence Bishnoi questioned amid reports of 'LB' initials on threat letter to Salman
39.article_body: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi was questioned on Monday in connection to a threat letter sent to Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan. This came as reports said today that the letter had the initials 'LB' signed on it. Letter also reportedly had 'GB', seen as a reference to Bishnoi's aide Goldy Brar, who's an accused in Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

40.title: BJP's bigotry damaged India's position: Rahul on Prophet remark row
40.article_body: Rahul Gandhi on Monday criticised BJP for its "shameless bigotry" amid the Prophet remark row, stating that BJP has not only isolated India but also damaged its global position. He added that India's internal division had weakened country externally. Gandhi's remarks came as countries including Qatar and Kuwait summoned Indian envoys over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's comments on Prophet Muhammad.

41.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for May?
41.article_body: The ICC on Monday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of May. Sri Lanka's Angelo Mathews and Asitha Fernando, and Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while Pakistan's Tuba Hassan and Bismah Maroof, and Jersey's Trinity Smith have been nominated in the women's category.

42.title: AAP is the only antidote to BJP: Kejriwal at 'Tiranga Yatra' in Gujarat
42.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal held a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Gujarat's Mehsana on Monday, ahead of the state Assembly elections. "People are scared to say anything against BJP. AAP is the only antidote...Gujarat wants change," Kejriwal added. AAP will be contesting the polls on all 182 seats in the state.

43.title: How much prize money has Rafael Nadal won in his tennis career?
43.article_body: Rafael Nadal won his 22nd singles Grand Slam on Sunday after winning the French Open for the 14th time. The 36-year-old Spaniard has won 92 singles titles and 11 doubles titles so far. In 2022, he has won four singles' titles, bagging a prize money of $5,718,607. Overall, Nadal has won a prize money of $130,681,472 in his career.

44.title: Helicopter bounces & turns 270 degrees while landing in Kedarnath; video surfaces
44.article_body: A private aviation company's helicopter bounced and turned 270 degrees while landing at a helipad in Kedarnath last week. A video of the incident has also surfaced online, following which Directorate General of Civil Aviation launched a probe into the incident. DGCA also issued an operational advisory, stating, "Pilots are to exercise caution for presence of any tailwinds during approaches."

45.title: It was like climbing Mt Everest for 1st time: Gavaskar on reaching 10,000 Test runs
45.article_body: Recalling the moment when he became the first cricketer to reach 10,000 Test runs, Sunil Gavaskar said, "[It was] magical because it hadn't been done before." He added, "Even 9,000 hadn't been done before, and I did it. But 9,000 is a four-digit number. 10,000 is a five-digit number...so it was almost like climbing Mt Everest for the first time."

46.title: U'khand board declares Class 10 & 12 results; Diya Rajput tops Class 12 with 97%
46.article_body: The Uttarakhand Board of School Education released the Class 10 and 12 board results on Monday. Diya Rajput topped Class 12 with 97% marks, while Mukul Silswal secured the first position in Class 10 with 99% marks. The overall pass percentage in Class 12 is 82.63%, while it is 77.74% in Class 10.

47.title: Lebanon invites US envoy to help end maritime dispute with Israel
47.article_body: The Lebanese government on Monday invited a US envoy to work out an agreement amid rising tensions between Lebanon and Israel over a maritime border dispute. This comes after Israel sent a natural gas storage and production ship to the disputed waters. On Sunday, Lebanon warned Israel not to start drilling in the Karish field.

48.title: 50 kg heroin found floating in sea days after Pak boat crew's arrest in Guj
48.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) and marine police have seized 50 kilograms of heroin worth ₹250 crore packed in plastic packets found floating in the sea off the Jakhau coast in Gujarat's Kutch district. Officials said the discovery came five days after seven Pakistani nationals on a boat were arrested in the Indian waters off the Gujarat coast.

49.title: Iraq sentences UK man to 15 yrs in jail for smuggling artefacts
49.article_body: An Iraqi court on Monday sentenced a 66-year-old British geologist to 15 years in prison for trying to smuggle ancient artefacts out of country "with criminal intent". Iraqi authorities had arrested James Fitton at Baghdad International Airport in March for carrying fragments of pottery in his luggage. The pottery fragments were reportedly taken from a heritage site in southern Iraq.

50.title: My mother would say, 'khel, tod': Umran on breaking windows growing up while playing
50.article_body: Fast bowler Umran Malik, in a recent interview, said that he loved fast bowling from the beginning. "When I was young, I would play with a plastic ball at home and would get scolded for breaking glass windows. But even then, my mother would not stop me from playing and would say, 'khel, tod' (Play, break)," he stated.

51.title: Salah rejected X-ray, played AFCON qualifier with injury: Egypt manager
51.article_body: Egypt manager Ehab Galal has revealed Mohamed Salah played through injury in their 1-0 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying victory against Guinea on Sunday, having "rejected Liverpool's request" for an X-ray. "He...will now undergo it," he added. Despite his injury, Salah played entire 90 minutes. Salah has been struggling with a groin problem he picked up in FA Cup final.

52.title: Musk warns Twitter he'll terminate $44 bn deal if fake accounts data not given
52.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has written a letter to Twitter saying the company is "actively resisting and thwarting" his right to information about fake accounts on the platform. This is a "clear material breach" of Twitter's obligations under the $44 billion merger deal, he wrote. Musk further said he reserves all rights to terminate the deal to acquire Twitter.

53.title: Mumbai Police to summon Nupur Sharma over her remarks on Prophet
53.article_body: Mumbai Police will soon send a summon to suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and record her statement in connection with her alleged comments against Prophet Muhammad, Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey said. The city police had last week registered an FIR against Sharma in this connection. She allegedly made the remarks during a television debate.

54.title: 16-year-old girl forced to sell her eggs 8 times by mother, her boyfriend in TN
54.article_body: A woman, along with two others, has been arrested for allegedly forcing her 16-year-old daughter to sell her eggs eight times at a private fertility clinic in Tamil Nadu's Erode. The woman and her boyfriend allegedly forced the victim to sell the eggs after she hit puberty at the age of 12. The couple reportedly received ₹20,000 for each egg.

55.title: Blocking my plane from reaching Serbia unprecedented: Lavrov
55.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov has termed Bulgaria, North Macedonia and Montenegro's move to close their airspace to block his plane from travelling to Serbia an "unprecedented" move. Lavrov said he hasn't received any explanation for the decision yet, adding that he'll invite his Serbian counterpart to Moscow. Notably, Bulgaria, North Macedonia and Montenegro are NATO member countries.

56.title: Trainee pilot injured as aircraft crashes while landing at Odisha airstrip
56.article_body: A trainee pilot sustained critical injuries after an aircraft went out of the runway while landing and crashed at the Birasal airstrip in Odisha's Dhenkanal on Monday. The Cessna 152 aircraft belongs to Government Aviation Training Institute (GATI). The student has been taken to a hospital and the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has started an investigation, officials said.

57.title: We're trying to create our own Marvel with 'Brahmāstra': Ranbir
57.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has stated that they have the opportunity to create India's own Marvel with 'Brahmāstra', adding director Ayan Mukerji is trying to do this with his Astraverse. "It's deep-rooted in Indian culture...'Brahmāstra' is not an end in itself but...a means to a larger end," the actor added. He further said that they have three parts ahead of them.

58.title: I've learned a lot from how Root went about his game in SL: Labuschagne
58.article_body: Talking about playing his first Test in Sri Lanka on a spin-friendly pitch, Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said it's about conquering that challenge. "Joe Root played phenomenally over there, I've learned a lot from how he went about his game there," he added. Root scored 228, 1, 186, 11 in January 2021. Sri Lanka-Australia will play two Tests in Galle.

59.title: Honey Singh pays tribute to Sidhu Moosewala, does his signature step at concert
59.article_body: Rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh paid tribute to Sidhu Moosewala during a concert in Mumbai on Sunday. In a video that has surfaced online, Honey Singh could be seen doing Moosewala's signature step on stage, with the late singer's song 'Uchiyan Ne Gallan Tere Yaar Diya' playing in the background. Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on May 29.

60.title: Salman to fly to Hyd for 'Kabhi Eid...' schedule amid threat: Report
60.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will be flying to Hyderabad for the next schedule of his film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali' amid the threat letter received by him and his father Salim Khan, reported ETimes. As per the report, Salman will be shooting in Hyderabad for 25 days after which he will return to Mumbai to join the 'Tiger 3' schedule.

61.title: President Ram Nath Kovind to visit Bengaluru on June 13
61.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind will visit Bengaluru on June 13, on a two-day official visit to Karnataka. The President will participate in the platinum jubilee celebrations of the Rashtriya Military School and stay at the Raj Bhavan during the night, as per the itinerary. He will leave for Delhi on June 14.

62.title: 4 men rob businessman on Western Express Highway in Mumbai
62.article_body: Four men were arrested for robbing a businessman of his phone and a gold chain on the Western Express Highway (WEH) in Mumbai, a police official said on Monday. The incident had taken place on May 25, the official added. The police had scanned CCTV footages to find the accused, who had intercepted the businessman's car in a cab.

63.title: Entry of Hindi has divided people in south: TN MP on 'Shudra' remark
63.article_body: Tamil Nadu MP TKS Elangovan, who earlier stated that Hindi imposition will denote Tamilians as 'Shudras', stated that "entry of" Hindi has divided people in southern India. "What I [meant] was that [usage of] Hindi...may bring...cultural practice...enforced in the north to us...It'll confirm our Shudra class," he said. Elangovan had earlier claimed that Hindi is spoken in "underdeveloped states".

64.title: Kuwait supermarkets remove Indian products over ex-BJP leader's remarks on Prophet
64.article_body: Supermarkets in Kuwait have removed Indian products from their shelves in protest against former BJP leader's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. A video showed workers at Al-Ardiya Co-Operative Society store covering or removing the products lined up on the shelves. "We, as a Kuwaiti Muslim people, do not accept insulting the Prophet," Nasser Al-Mutairi, CEO of the store, said.

65.title: Disneyland staff interrupts marriage proposal, Disney apologises as video goes viral
65.article_body: Disney apologised after a video of a marriage proposal being interrupted by a Disneyland Paris employee went viral. The employee is seen grabbing the ring from the hands of a man while he's proposing and telling the couple to get down from the platform they were on. "We regret how this was handled...and offered to make it right," said Disney.

66.title: You deserve this and so much more: Sunny on Sharvari's IIFA win
66.article_body: Actor Sunny Kaushal took to Instagram Stories to congratulate his rumoured girlfriend actress Sharvari Wagh for winning Star Debut of the Year at the 2022 IIFA Awards. He wrote along with her picture, "Couldn't be prouder Sharu! You deserve this and so so sooo much more! Congratulations Sharvari. Big tight hug." Sharvari won the award for 'Bunty Aur Babli 2'.

67.title: Railways doubles ticket booking limit on IRCTC, users can book up to 24 tickets per month
67.article_body: Indian Railways has doubled online ticket booking limit through IRCTC website and app. An Aadhaar-linked user ID can now book up to 24 tickets in a month instead of 12, provided that one of the passengers should be verifiable through Aadhaar. A user ID which is not linked with Aadhaar can book up to 12 tickets in a month.

68.title: 2006 Varanasi serial blasts convict Waliullah Khan gets death penalty
68.article_body: Terrorist Waliullah Khan, who was convicted in the 2006 Varanasi serial blasts case, has been awarded death penalty and life imprisonment. At least 20 people were killed and over 100 others were injured in the blasts at Sankat Mochan temple and cantonment railway station on March 7, 2006. The Allahabad High Court had transferred the case to Ghaziabad district court.

69.title: World's biggest 4-day work week trial with no loss of salary begins in UK
69.article_body: The world's biggest trial of four-day work week is set to begin in the UK on Monday, with more than 70 companies and 3,300 employees. The trial will not result in any loss of pay for employees. It is based on the 100:80:100 model, implying that employees will get 100% of pay for 80% of time and maintain 100% productivity.

70.title: U'khand bus accident to be probed, pilgrims' safety a priority: Guv
70.article_body: Uttarakhand Governor Gurmit Singh said on Monday that reason behind the bus accident near Damta, which claimed 26 lives, will be investigated, reiterating that pilgrims' safety is the state government's priority. "Lesson(s) will be taken from the accident...and a robust SOP will be prepared," Singh added. The bus, which fell into a gorge on Sunday evening, left four others injured.

71.title: UP Police releases pics of 40 suspects involved in Kanpur clashes, seeks info
71.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has released photographs of 40 men in connection with the clashes and stone-pelting reported in Kanpur on Friday. Police suspect that these men played an active role in the violence, that left several injured. Police have put out a contact number and assured that the identity of those providing information regarding the individuals will be kept confidential.

72.title: 3 die, over 60 hospitalised after drinking contaminated water in K'taka
72.article_body: Three people died and at least 62 others, including 23 children, were admitted to hospital after allegedly drinking contaminated water over the last week in Raichur town of Karnataka. CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced ₹5-lakh aid for the families of the deceased. As per local health officials, the pipe supplying water is suspected to have been linked with drain water.

73.title: PIL seeking CBI probe into KK's death filed in Calcutta High Court
73.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in Calcutta High Court seeking a probe by CBI into late singer KK's demise. A second PIL has also been filed in the court demanding further investigation of the death by an independent agency alleging mismanagement at his final concert. KK passed away aged 53 following a live performance on May 31.

74.title: 7-yr-old girl injured during shooting practice in camp in Thane
74.article_body: Five people, including two National Cadet Corps (NCC) personnel, were booked after a 7-year-old girl was injured in an accidental firing incident during a training camp in Thane district, the police said on Sunday. The incident took place during firing practice at the camp. The girl has been admitted to Mumbai's JJ Hospital in a serious condition, an official said.

75.title: Need to make Indian banks, currency important part of international trade: PM
75.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said it is necessary to focus on how to make our domestic banks and currency an important part of the international supply chain and trade. PM Modi inaugurated the 'Iconic Week Celebrations' by the Ministry of Finance and Corporate Affairs as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

76.title: Hindi is language of underdeveloped states, will make us 'Shudras': TN MP
76.article_body: Tamil Nadu MP TKS Elangovan has alleged that attempts were being made to "impose Manu dharma through the imposition of Hindi", adding that Hindi is the language of underdeveloped states. "What will Hindi do? Only make us Shudras. It will do no benefit to us," he added. Several leaders criticised the DMK leader over his remarks.

77.title: Stones pelted between 2 groups after biker accidentally hits man in Agra
77.article_body: Clashes between two communities erupted in Uttar Pradesh's Agra after a bike rider slipped on an under-construction road and accidentally hit a passerby in Tajganj, police said. An argument took place between the two persons, which escalated to stone-pelting between local groups, police added. "A heavy police force was deployed and the situation was brought under control," Agra SSP said.

78.title: Who is Angelo Moriondo, 'godfather of espresso machines' honoured by Google?
78.article_body: Google Doodle on Monday paid tribute to Angelo Moriondo, the 'godfather of espresso machines', on his 171st birthday. The Italian inventor is credited for patenting the first known espresso machine in 1884. Moriondo's machine consisted of a large boiler that pushed heated water through coffee grounds, with a second boiler producing steam to flash the coffee and complete the brew.

79.title: Film on India's Recycle Man Binish Desai in the works
79.article_body: A film on the life of environmentalist Dr Binish Desai, known as the 'Recycle Man of India', is under development. "[It'll] be...world's first mainstream Bollywood movie which will revolve around a change maker's journey working towards eliminating the idea of waste," Desai said. The biopic will aim at promoting sustainability with a carbon-negative approach throughout its making, makers said.

80.title: Why no arrest has been made yet?: Owaisi over Nupur Sharma's remarks
80.article_body: Following Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi asked, "Why there is still no arrest against the spokesperson (now suspended)?" He added that instant action is taken when someone speaks or tweets against PM Narendra Modi but no action has been taken against Sharma who "insulted Prophet Muhammad".

81.title: Cong worker out on bail in 2 murder cases shoots wife dead in MP
81.article_body: A Congress party worker who is currently on bail in two murder cases, including that of his sister, allegedly shot his wife to death in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Sunday, police said. The accused, identified as Rishabh Bhadoriya, allegedly killed his wife in front of their children on suspicion of infidelity. Bhadoriya is currently absconding, police added.

82.title: Russia plans to restart telescope Germany shut over Ukraine war
82.article_body: Russia's space agency head Dmitry Rogozin has said that he's given instructions for restarting German telescope eROSITA "despite Germany's demand" that it should be shut down. Earlier, a German institute shut the telescope in protest over the Ukraine war. People "don't have a moral right to halt this research...just because their pro-fascist views are close to our enemies", he claimed.

83.title: We need to give our youth arms training: Akal Takht Jathedar
83.article_body: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh while addressing people on Operation Bluestar anniversary on Monday said, "We need to...give [our youth] arms training." He also called on Sikh organisations to encourage youth in Punjab to do so. Moreover, he objected to churches in the state's villages and added, "Sikh preachers must come out of...AC rooms...It's time to go to villages."

84.title: 5 booked for making casteist remarks against doctor in UP
84.article_body: Police have booked five people, including two doctors, for hurling casteist remarks at a doctor in Pratapgarh Medical College, Uttar Pradesh. In his complaint, Dr Sachin Pasi alleged that Dr Jai Prakash Verma hurled casteist remarks against him when the former opposed Verma for taking patients to his private clinic. Notably, four others were booked for supporting the casteist remarks.

85.title: Nadal's 14th French Open, 22nd Slam win at 36 is incredible: Tendulkar
85.article_body: Congratulating Rafael Nadal following his 14th French Open win, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "To go out there and win a record 14th French Open and 22nd Grand Slam at the age of 36 is an incredible achievement." Shoaib Malik said, "Mate you defy the odds every-time, age really is just a number for you! Keep going strong, champion."

86.title: BJP leaders trained in 'hate politics' by PM Modi: AAP's Sanjay Singh
86.article_body: AAP leader Sanjay Singh said in 75 years, no one has "bowed India's head in shame" as much as PM Narendra Modi. "BJP leaders and spokespersons make mistakes because they're trained in hate politics by PM Modi and the whole country bears the consequences," Singh added. His remarks came a day after BJP suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma.

87.title: IAF aircraft to transport bodies of those killed in U'khand bus mishap to MP
87.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that Indian Air Force (IAF) aircraft has been arranged to transport the bodies of pilgrims killed in the bus accident in Uttarakhand to Madhya Pradesh. Chouhan said that the bodies will be sent to MP's Khajuraho after postmortem. "Our teams will be ready...and will take...the bodies to four different villages," he added.

88.title: Video shows Radhika Merchant's dance at event hosted by Mukesh & Nita Ambani
88.article_body: Videos of Anant Ambani's fiancee Radhika Merchant's Arangetram dance performance on Sunday have been shared online. Merchant was seen performing her debut Bharatanatyam dance after finishing her formal training during an event hosted by Anant's parents Mukesh and Nita Ambani at Jio World Centre in Mumbai. Actors Salman Khan, Aamir Khan and Ranveer Singh also attended the performance.

89.title: He's taken right method, but format is wrong: RP Singh on Kohli's form
89.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said Virat Kohli is taking time to come back to his form because he's playing more T20 cricket where the scope of consuming deliveries is less. "You can start by scoring 60(55)...you can't expect to score 100(55)," Singh added. "Kohli has taken the right method but the format is wrong," he further said.

90.title: He is recovering at home: Bobby on rumours of Dharmendra being critical in hospital
90.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has refuted rumours that his father, veteran actor Dharmendra, is critical in a hospital. "He is absolutely fine. He is at home and he is recovering. He is doing well. Thank you so much for your love and affection," Bobby said. Dharmendra was hospitalised last month following a muscle spasm.

91.title: Atmosphere of threat being propagated in state: Pilot on Moosewala’s death
91.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday met late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala’s family in Mansa. "It's tragic how our leader was killed. An atmosphere of threat is being propagated in state repetitively," Pilot said. "The Centre and state government should probe it (death) and take strict action," he stated. "Such an incident happened to instil fear in people," Pilot added.

92.title: Bangkok celebrates its 1st LGBTQ+ Pride march in 16 years
92.article_body: Bangkok on Sunday marked its first LGBTQ+ Pride march in the last 16 years. The event, named 'Naruemit Pride 2022' was held with support from Governor of Bangkok Chadchart Sittipunt and witnessed participation from thousands of people, who waved rainbow flags on the streets. Two bills on LGBTQ+ unions are waiting to go to the parliament in Thailand, Reuters reported.

93.title: ED raids on Satyendra Jain are an act of torture: Sanjay Singh
93.article_body: AAP MP Sanjay Singh has criticised the Enforcement Directorate raids at Delhi Health Minister Satyendra Jain's residence. "This is an act of torture, not an act of raid because Jain has been questioned for five days. He is an honest person," Singh said. "Whatever Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal said today is the training of the BJP itself," he added.

94.title: Lalu to go abroad for kidney transplant, requests court to release passport
94.article_body: RJD chief and former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav has filed an application at a special CBI court in Ranchi, seeking the release of his passport for renewal as he has to go abroad for a kidney transplant. Yadav's lawyer said, most likely, the former will go to Singapore. "Process for an appointment with the doctor...is underway," the lawyer added.

95.title: Suspension not enough, send them to jail: Mayawati after BJP expels members
95.article_body: A day after BJP members Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal were suspended over remarks hurting religious sentiments, BSP chief Mayawati called for their arrest. "Only suspension is not enough, they must be jailed under strict laws," she wrote on Twitter. She said that objectionable language should not be used against any religion and the BJP must rein in its members.

96.title: I had auditioned for 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi': Ayushmann
96.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana revealed in an interview that he had auditioned for a role in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. "Actually, I made it as an RJ by the time I auditioned for the show. So I told...casting director 'Bro, I'm going'. So I couldn't do that...show," he added. Ayushmann further said the role eventually went to Pulkit Samrat.

97.title: BMC plans to rebuild old bridges in Mumbai's eastern suburbs
97.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) plans to reconstruct old bridges and widen new ones in Mumbai's eastern suburbs. The project is estimated to cost ₹51.17 crore and expected to be completed in 18 months, excluding the monsoon. "The process of appointing a contractor for executing the work has also been initiated," a BMC official said.

98.title: Man kills self in Gurugram hotel; 5-page suicide note blames wife, her family
98.article_body: A 31-year-old man died by suicide in a hotel room in Gurugram. Police said a five-page suicide note has been recovered from the man. Police added that in the suicide note, the man accused his wife and her family of harassing him and threatening to file a case against him. The victim's brother said he was under lot of stress.

99.title: Migrants from Delhi main reason behind Nagpur's COVID-19 surge: Minister
99.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, state minister Nitin Raut said, "Main reason behind rising coronavirus cases in Nagpur is migrants coming from Delhi." Raut claimed most of the 35 cases traced on Monday are from Delhi. "I feel we should do [contact] tracing at airport itself and make maximum efforts for testing in urban and rural areas," he added.

100.title: Actresses have reached out to me to praise my work, it's motivating: Kiara
100.article_body: Kiara Advani revealed that whenever she likes any contemporary's performance in a film, she gets her number to praise her performance even if she doesn't know her personally. "That's happened with me as well, when other actresses have reached out to me, even those I don't know, to tell me how much they enjoyed my work...It's so motivating," she added.

101.title: Not followed Waqar; my idols include Bumrah, Shami & Bhuvneshwar: Umran
101.article_body: Fast bowler Umran Malik said he has not followed ex-Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis. "I have a natural action. My idols include (Jasprit) Bumrah, (Mohammed) Shami and Bhuvneshwar (Kumar)," he added. "I used to follow them when I was playing while coming through the ranks," he stated. Umran was named in Team India squad for the T20I series against South Africa.

102.title: 18-year-old Coco jumps to career-best 13th, Nadal moves to 4th in rankings
102.article_body: American tennis player Coco Gauff has jumped 10 spots to be ranked 13th, her career-best in the WTA rankings. Coco entered her maiden Grand Slam final in the recently-concluded French Open, where she lost the final to Iga Swiatek. Meanwhile, Rafael Nadal, who won the men's singles French Open title, moved one spot to be ranked fourth.

103.title: Maha schools to reopen on June 15; masks not mandatory: Minister
103.article_body: Schools in Maharashtra will reopen on June 15 with COVID-19-appropriate measures regardless of the rising cases, state School Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad said on Monday. She said masks are not mandatory and new SOPs will be issued to schools. Further decisions will be taken in accordance with the situation, she added.

104.title: Delving into new character is like being a tourist in new country: Rogowski
104.article_body: German actor Franz Rogowski has said delving into a new character is like being a tourist in a new country. "In...beginning, you start taking pictures of...place you're visiting. Then, you go to restaurants, " he said, adding, "After a couple of days, you start looking at...narrow lanes and dusty market areas. Bit by bit, you start having real experiences."

105.title: Lavrov forced to cancel Serbia visit as 3 countries close airspace
105.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov was forced to cancel his visit to Serbia after three of the latter country's neighbours, Bulgaria, North Macedonia and Montenegro, closed their airspace to the aircraft carrying the minister. A ministry spokesperson confirmed the news during a broadcast on a TV channel, Russian news agency TASS reported. Earlier, Serbia secured a gas deal with Russia.

106.title: Expecting bit of spin, but pitch not dry square: Finch on Lankan surfaces
106.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch has commented on the type of pitches that will be on offer on their tour to Sri Lanka which starts from Tuesday. "Expecting there to be a bit of spin there but it might be tacky...It's not a dry square," Finch said. He added, "There will be a lot of sun over the next 24 hours."

107.title: Should be in Limca Book of Records: Sule over raids on 'Deshmukh family'
107.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik and ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh have not done anything but are "stuck" in jail, NCP MP Supriya Sule said. "109 times raid on Deshmukh family should make it to Limca Book of Records," Sule added. "Today or tomorrow, the court will give them a clean chit. Whoever speaks against the Centre is raided," Sule stated.

108.title: Rahul Gandhi to meet Moosewala's family in Mansa on Tuesday
108.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will meet the late singer Sidhu Moosewala's family in the latter's native village in Punjab's Mansa district on Tuesday. Notably, this will be Gandhi's first meeting with the family since Moosewala's assassination. Gandhi had condoled on the demise of the 28-year-old singer-turned politician who was shot dead by assailants last month.

109.title: Rohit Shetty starts shooting for 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', shares video
109.article_body: Rohit Shetty has started shooting for the stunt-based reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' in Cape Town, South Africa. The filmmaker, who hosts the show, took to Instagram on Monday to share a video where he is seen in a helicopter. "Time to go crazy, wild...and real once again! Khatron Ke Khiladi!! Shoot begins," Rohit wrote while sharing the video.

110.title: 8 suspected sharp shooters who killed Sidhu Moosewala identified, pics released
110.article_body: Punjab Police have identified the eight suspected sharp shooters who allegedly killed singer Sidhu Moosewala. They belong to Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Maharashtra. They are Manpreet Singh Mannu, Jagroop Singh Roopa and Harkamal alias Ranu from Punjab, Priyavrat Fauji and Manjeet alias Bholu from Haryana, Saurav Mahakal and Santosh Jadhav from Pune and Subhash Banuda from Rajasthan.

111.title: Video of Joe Root's bat standing on its own goes viral, fan says 'What is this sorcery?'
111.article_body: A video of ex-England captain Joe Root's bat standing on its own when the batter was at the non-striker's end has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "I knew @root66 was talented but not as magic as this...What is this sorcery?" Another fan wrote, "His bat is unusually square & flat at the bottom."

112.title: Layer'r Shot apologises for controversial ads accused of promoting rape culture
112.article_body: Layer'r Shot has apologised after facing criticism over its advertisements, which were accused of promoting rape culture. "We never intended to hurt anyone’s sentiments...or outrage any woman’s modesty, or promote any sort of culture, as wrongly perceived by some," it said. "We...apologise for...advertisements that consequentially caused rage amongst individuals and several communities."

113.title: Delhi Police books unknown persons for sending death threats to Nupur Sharma
113.article_body: Delhi Police has registered an FIR against unknown persons for allegedly threatening and harassing former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her alleged remarks on Prophet Muhammad during a television debate last month. "We have started an investigation and are looking into tweets and comments posted by unknown persons on Sharma's video," an officer said.

114.title: Rafael Nadal refuses retirement rumours, says 'I will keep fighting'
114.article_body: After winning his 22nd Grand Slam, Spanish tennis player Rafael Nadal denied the rumours about his retirement. "I don't know what can happen in the future. I will keep fighting to try to keep going," the 36-year-old said after winning his 14th French Open title. Nadal defeated Casper Ruud 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 in the French Open final.

115.title: Barring injury, Root will go miles past my record: Alastair Cook
115.article_body: Ex-England captain Alastair Cook, who's the highest run-scorer for England in Test cricket, has said that Joe Root will go miles past his record. "For the most complete batsmen in all three forms, it's Root. His consistency is incredible," added Cook. Root crossed the 10,000-run mark in their win against New Zealand in the first match of the three-Test series.

116.title: 15 Twitter, FB accounts booked over communal clashes in Kanpur
116.article_body: The police have booked 15 social media accounts on Twitter and Facebook for allegedly inciting people in connection to the communal clashes in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The violence, in which about 40 people were injured, had broken out following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Earlier, 36 people were arrested following the violence.

117.title: Russian general killed in eastern Ukraine: Report
117.article_body: A Russian state media journalist on Sunday said that a Russian general was killed in eastern Ukraine. However, the report didn't say precisely when and where Major General Roman Kutuzov was killed. Notably, Russia already classifies military deaths as state secrets even in times of peace and hasn't updated its official casualty figures in Ukraine since March 25.

118.title: Calendar Grand Slam will motivate Nadal to keep going: Henman
118.article_body: Tim Henman said the chance to complete the Calendar Grand Slam will motivate Rafael Nadal to play at Wimbledon and beyond. Earlier, Nadal said he'd play at Wimbledon only if his body allowed it. Nadal has won first two Grand Slams of the year for the first time in his career following his record-extending 14th French Open title on Sunday.

119.title: Pune adequately prepared if COVID-19 cases rise: PMC health chief
119.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's Health Department chief Dr Ashish Bharati said the civic body is adequately prepared if COVID-19 cases rise. "There are at least 800-900 beds across PMC-run hospitals…Around 1,000-1,200 tests are being conducted daily in the city as the number of new cases has gone up slightly," he added. Maharashtra reported over 1,400 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

120.title: Man impersonates police to rob senior citizens in Hyd, nabbed
120.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police nabbed an auto driver who'd impersonated a police officer to carry out theft on Saturday. The accused, identified as Ramavath Naresh, would reportedly 'summon' senior citizens to the police station after threatening them with false cases and rob them once they boarded his auto. Police seized materials worth ₹80,000, including gold ornaments, from Naresh's possession.

121.title: Delhi Police to reward 2 Army aspirants for chasing down thieves escaping in auto
121.article_body: Two Army aspirants chased down mobile phone snatchers who were trying to escape in an autorickshaw and managed to recover the device after a fight. The duo will be awarded a commendation certificate and given ₹2,000 each as a reward by Delhi Police. There was a scuffle between the two sides and the complainant and his friend sustained minor injuries.

122.title: PhonePe is a made in India company, we will list in India: CEO
122.article_body: PhonePe Founder and CEO Sameer Nigam told CNN News-18 that it is moving its holding company from Singapore to India and plans to launch an IPO in India. "We are a made in India company. Every office, data centre, and employee of ours is here. There's no reason why we shouldn't contribute to wealth creation in this market," Nigam said.

123.title: Kartik shares 'Ami Je Tomar' rock version as 'Bhool...' crosses ₹150cr
123.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan on Monday took to social media to share the rock version of 'Ami Je Tomar' as his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' crossed the ₹150 crore mark at the Indian box office. He wrote alongside the video, "150 cr india mein... aur toh aur 200 cr Worldwide ho gaye hain doston. Meri Khushi ka thikana nahi hai."

124.title: Russia shouldn't shut US embassy, dialogue must continue: Envoy
124.article_body: The US ambassador to Moscow, John Sullivan, has said that Russia must not close the American embassy. The statement comes amid growing hostilities between the two countries over the Ukraine war. "We must preserve the ability to speak to each other," said Sullivan. "We can't just break off diplomatic relations and stop talking to each other," he added.

125.title: How the IPL performers play for India in SA T20Is will matter: Raina
125.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina has said the upcoming T20I series against South Africa will be important for the IPL performers who have been selected in the squad. "How they perform for India will matter. The mindset is important if you have to play for India," he stated. India will play five-match T20I series against South Africa, starting on June 9.

126.title: Wishing you success in the coming year: Pujara on Rahane's b'day
126.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara took to Twitter to wish batter Ajinkya Rahane on his 34th birthday. "A very happy birthday brother Rahane. Wishing you happiness and success in the coming year. Enjoy your day," he tweeted. Harbhajan Singh also wished Rahane on his birthday. Taking to Twitter, Harbhajan wrote, "Happy birthday Rahane...Have a fabulous year ahead."

127.title: No change in existing banknotes: RBI on reports it may use Tagore, Kalam's pics
127.article_body: The RBI has denied reports that it is considering changes to the existing currency and banknotes by replacing the face of Mahatma Gandhi with that of others. The RBI on Monday clarified that there will be no change in existing currency and banknotes. Earlier, reports said that RBI is considering using Rabindranath Tagore and APJ Abdul Kalam's pictures on banknotes.

128.title: Chopped pieces of body found in gunny bag in Delhi, head & torso missing
128.article_body: Chopped pieces of a body were found in a gunny bag in an open field near the Kalyanpuri area in East Delhi on Sunday. The head and torso were missing, police said, adding that the body was in such a state that it was impossible to ascertain the gender. Police said it appears that the murder took place somewhere else.

129.title: We were living in shock, Vicky was told to leave me: Ankita on Sushant's death
129.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande said that she and her husband Vicky Jain were living in state of shock after late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death. She said that social media turned abusive towards Vicky and he was told to leave her. "Had it been some other guy, he would have quit, but Vicky stood there and became my strength," she added.

130.title: Scarlett wins Best Hero, Tom wins Best Performance at MTV Awards
130.article_body: Actress Scarlett Johansson won the Best Hero award for 'Black Widow' at the 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards. Actor Tom Holland was awarded Best Performance in a Movie for 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' also won the Best Movie award and 'Euphoria' was declared Best Show. Actress Zendaya won Best Performance in a Show for 'Euphoria'.

131.title: China eases COVID-19 curbs in Beijing; cinemas, restaurants open
131.article_body: China lifted several COVID-19 restrictions in Beijing on Monday as the number of cases declined. While restaurants can resume dine-in services, cinemas have been allowed to open with a limited capacity of 75%. Public transport has also resumed in most districts. The city didn't report any domestically transmitted infection in the last 15 hours, an official said on Monday.

132.title: La Liga is a good league for Lewandowski, it is more technical: Pires
132.article_body: Former Arsenal player Robert Pires has said that Robert Lewandowski's move to Barcelona is his "last chance for another great contract". He further said that La Liga is a good league for Lewandowski. "Mainly because he would have even more freedom in Spain compared to the Bundesliga; La Liga is more technical, it seems perfect for him," he stated.

133.title: CCTV video shows man taking selfie with Sidhu Moosewala on day of murder; probe ordered
133.article_body: A CCTV footage purportedly showing a man taking selfies with Sidhu Moosewala on the day he was shot dead has surfaced online. The video shows a group of men standing in front of the singer's car when the man approached him for selfie. Police has reportedly launched a probe, suspecting two of these men informed the shooters after Moosewala left.

134.title: PFI activists stopped during march towards Kerala CM's house, water cannons fired
134.article_body: Popular Front of India activists marched towards state Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's residence on Monday. PFI activists were stopped and water cannons and tear gas were used to disperse them, reports said. This comes after ED attached 33 PFI bank accounts with ₹68 lakh in a money laundering case. ED also said that PFI raised funds from China.

135.title: Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy visits war frontlines, thanks soldiers
135.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday reached at the frontline positions close to where intense fighting is going on. He met and thanked his troops fighting the war against Russian forces. "I want to thank you for your great work, for your service, for protecting all of us, our state. I am grateful to everyone," he told them.

136.title: Ukrainian troops burned tonnes of grains before leaving Mariupol: DPR
136.article_body: An official of the separatist Donetsk People's Republic, Yan Gagin, said that the Ukrainian soldiers set fire to tonnes of grains of corn and wheat kept in storage facilities at Mariupol seaport before leaving. "Judging by the smell and appearance, it is unsuitable for further use," Gagin said. The grains cannot even be used as cattle feed, he added.

137.title: 2 minors raped in Hyd in separate incidents, accused arrested
137.article_body: Cases of sexual assault on two minor girls in Hyderabad were reported on Sunday, days after a 17-year-old girl was allegedly gangraped in city's Jubillee Hills area. In first case, police arrested two accused, a taxi driver and his friend, for allegedly sexually abusing an 11-year-old girl. In second incident, a 21-year-old was arrested for kidnapping and raping minor girl.

138.title: Jennifer Lopez wins Generation Award at 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards
138.article_body: Actress-singer Jennifer Lopez was honoured with the Generation Award at the 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards given to actors whose diverse contributions have made them household names. In her speech, she thanked her fans, manager and children for "teaching [her] to love". Jennifer also won the award for best song for 'On My Way' from the 'Marry Me' soundtrack.

139.title: Indian expat finds ₹2cr in Dubai elevator, honoured for handing it over to police
139.article_body: An Indian expatriate was honoured in Dubai for handing over money found in an elevator to the police. Tariq Mahmood Khalid Mahmood handed over 1 million Dirhams (around ₹2.11 crore) at the Al Barsha Police Station. The Director of the police station said, "His (Mahmood's) morals represent the noble values of our society that we're very proud of."

140.title: PM launches new series of coins, says 'it will remind people of goal of amrit kal'
140.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has released a special series of ₹1, ₹2, ₹5, ₹10 and ₹20 coins, featuring the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' design. The "visually impaired friendly" coins will be a part of the circulation, the government said. PM Modi said the coins will "remind people of the goal of amrit kal" and motivate them to work towards India's development.

141.title: Anupam Kher announces his 525th project, asks fans to suggest title
141.article_body: Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram, wrote, "Today I start the landmark 525th project of my career. A beautiful story of a common man." He stated they are yet to finalise the title of the project as he, the producer, and the director have different titles. "We thought the best way to finalise is to ask you all," he wrote.

142.title: Pune sees traffic congestion as schools reopen after summer break
142.article_body: Many areas in Pune witnessed traffic congestion as schools reopened after a summer break on Monday. Traffic police officials said they asked schools to deploy their staff at entry points. "We have deployed our full strength on the roads and have also stepped patrolling in the areas with possible traffic issues," Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) Rahul Shrirame said.

143.title: WB cabinet passes bill to make Mamata Chancellor of state-run universities
143.article_body: The West Bengal cabinet on Monday approved a proposal to make Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee Chancellor of all state-run universities under different departments like Health, Agriculture, Animal Husbandry and Minority Affairs. According to officials, the CM is going to replace Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar, who currently holds the post. The decision will be taken up for approval in the state Assembly.

144.title: Players selected for T20I series vs SA need leader like KL Rahul: Raina
144.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina said Team India players selected for the T20I series against South Africa need a leader like KL Rahul. Raina added, "There are new fast bowlers...Umran Malik...and...Arshdeep Singh. Both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik...will also be there...so I feel Rahul's presence will bring calmness." The first T20I will be played on June 9.

145.title: B'luru's railway terminal with airport-like facilities to start op tonight
145.article_body: The railway terminal in Bengaluru's Baiyappanahalli that will provide facilities like an airport will begin operations on Monday night. The Banaswadi-Ernakulam Express will be the first to run from the terminal at 7 pm, an official of the South Western Railway (SWR) said. It is expected that the railway terminal will be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi later.

146.title: Former CPI (Maoist) sub-zonal commander held from jungle in Jharkhand
146.article_body: A former CPI (Maoist) sub-zonal commander was arrested by the police following a tip-off from a jungle in Jharkhand's Garhwa district. The accused, identified as Bhanu Singh Kharwar, made an attempt to escape the jungle with his lover but was intercepted by the police, the Superintendent of Police Anjani Kumar Jha said. Notably, around 10 cases were pending against Kharwar.

147.title: One of the most underrated cricketers: Sehwag on Rahane's 34th birthday
147.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish India batter Ajinkya Rahane on his 34th birthday. "One of the most underrated cricketers, and the man who led India to its greatest ever overseas Test series win. Happy Birthday Rahane," wrote Sehwag. Harbhajan also wished Rahane, tweeting, "Happy birthday Rahane. Keep smiling, [and] have a fabulous year ahead."

148.title: Truck seized in drive against sand mafia in 2018 stolen in Pune, 2 held
148.article_body: Police have arrested the owner and driver of a truck for allegedly stealing the vehicle, which was seized by government officials in 2018 for illegal sand transportation, from the tehsildar's office. The truck was again being used for illegal sand transportation. Police stated that nine trucks were attached at the Shevalwadi toll post during action against sand mafia in 2018.

149.title: 'Tumhara Moosewala kar denge,' says threat letter sent to Salman Khan
149.article_body: The threat letter received by actor Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan allegedly stated, "Tumhara Moosewala kar denge (you'll end up like Moosewala)." Salim Khan found the letter, an officer said. This comes days after Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa, following which police suspected role of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi and his Canada-based associate Goldy Brar.

150.title: Haasan's 'Vikram' crosses ₹100-cr mark in India, earns over ₹150 cr worldwide
150.article_body: Kamal Haasan's action thriller movie 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark in India within three days of its release. According to entertainment journalist Sreedhar Pillai, the Lokesh Kanagaraj directorial has collected more than ₹150 crore at the worldwide box office. As per reports, the Hindi-dubbed version of the film has earned only ₹2 crore in its first three days.

151.title: I feel ODI cricket is the most boring contest, it is struggling: Aakash Chopra
151.article_body: After ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri suggested terminating the bilateral series in T20 cricket and only playing the format in the World Cups, commentator Aakash Chopra said it's the ODI format that's struggling and needs change. "ODIs [are] the most meaningless...it's not the T20I cricket that is struggling. Let T20 internationals continue because the broadcasters [also] need them," he stated.

152.title: He will eat you alive: Ruud on playing defensive against Nadal on clay
152.article_body: Norway's Casper Ruud has commented after losing the French Open final to Spain's Rafael Nadal on Sunday. "(I) wanted to get the match going and maybe try to win the set," Ruud said. "But then he stepped up...When you are playing defensive against Rafa on clay, he will eat you alive," he added.

153.title: Your belief helped make me who I am today: Sanjay on dad's birth anniversary
153.article_body: Sanjay Dutt took to Twitter on Monday to share a post remembering his late father, actor Sunil Dutt, on his birth anniversary. He shared a collage featuring two stills from his 2003 movie 'Munna Bhai M.B.B.S'. "Your belief and love helped make me who I'm today. You were, are and will always be my hero. Happy birthday, Dad," Sanjay wrote.

154.title: Saddened, says Ex-Tripura Governor as BJP suspends Nupur Sharma
154.article_body: After BJP suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma, former Governor of Tripura Tathagata Roy said he is “saddened” over the “treatment” of Sharma. “I am now an ordinary member and supporter of BJP...I have nothing to fear or expect from the BJP,” Roy added. “I support BJP because it is the closest to my thinking,” Roy stated.

155.title: Never become complacent: Kamal Haasan to 'Vikram' director Lokesh
155.article_body: 'Vikram' director Lokesh Kanagaraj took to Twitter and wrote he was "overwhelmed" by the support of the audience for his film. He wrote, "I don't know how I'm gonna repay you guys for...this love." On Twitter, Kamal Haasan replied to Lokesh's tweet and wrote, "The only way you can do any debt management with...loving audience is to never become complacent."

156.title: Tribal mangoes from Maharashtra’s Nashik exported to US for 1st time
156.article_body: In a first, tribal farmers from Maharashtra's Nashik have exported naturally-grown organic mangoes to the United States. An official said that this consignment has enabled these farmers to earn more than 200 per cent of what they earn in local markets. Reports said that the 1.2 tonne consignment was sourced from tribal growers from nine talukas of Nashik.

157.title: UK PM Boris Johnson to face no-confidence vote today
157.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson will face a no-confidence vote by lawmakers in the governing Conservative Party on Monday evening, the chairman of the 1922 Committee Graham Brady said. Reuters reported that Johnson has been under growing pressure after a report documented alcohol-fuelled parties at his Downing Street office and residence when Britain was under strict COVID-19 lockdowns.

158.title: India responds to Pakistan's reaction over former BJP leader's remark on Prophet Muhammad
158.article_body: India responded to Pakistan's reaction over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remark on Prophet Muhammad. The government said, "The Government of India accords highest respect to all religions. This is quite unlike Pakistan where fanatics are eulogized and monuments made in their honour." Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif had said, "India under [PM] Modi is trampling religious freedoms & persecuting Muslims."

159.title: Russian ministry website appears hacked, data protected: Reports
159.article_body: Russia's Ministry of Construction, Housing and Utilities website was apparently hacked, with the search results for the site showing a "Glory to Ukraine" sign in Ukrainian, Reuters reported. A ministry representative had said that while the site was down, the users' data was protected, according to state media RIA. Other media claimed that hackers had demanded ransom, RIA also reported.

160.title: Delhi Cong passes resolution to make Rahul Gandhi as party's national president
160.article_body: The Delhi unit of the Congress party has unanimously passed a resolution requesting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to become the party's national president. "In these challenging times, only a strong leader like Rahul Gandhi...can further strengthen and rejuvenate the Congress, to expose the lies and falsehood of BJP and AAP," the resolution said.

161.title: Scorpio car hits biker and speeds off after argument in Delhi, video surfaces
161.article_body: A video showing a Scorpio car hitting a biker and speeding off following an argument between the SUV's driver and a group of bikers in Delhi has surfaced. The biker fell off his bike in the incident. "Scorpio car driver almost killed a few of our riders and threatened to kill us by crushing us under car," a biker tweeted.

162.title: LIC share price hits record low, market value falls below ₹5 lakh crore
162.article_body: Shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) hit record low on Monday after falling nearly 2%. The state-run insurer's shares fell to an all-time low of ₹782.50 on the NSE and its market capitalisation fell below ₹5 lakh crore. Notably, LIC had become India's fifth-largest company after listing on May 17, with a market value of ₹5.70 lakh crore.

163.title: Don't make my address public, getting death threats: BJP's Naveen Jindal
163.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) Delhi media cell head, Naveen Kumar Jindal, who was expelled by the party over his remarks against Prophet Muhammad, said he and his family members are receiving death threats. "I have a special request to all, please do not make my address public," he wrote on Twitter. He also asked Delhi Police to take note.

164.title: Woman, her son go to wash clothes, drown in river in Pune
164.article_body: A woman and her son drowned in a river in Pune's Naigaon after they went there to wash clothes on Sunday. The woman drowned while trying to save her son, who had fallen into the water. The woman's bother and a relative brought the duo out and rushed them to a hospital where they were declared brought dead.

165.title: A lot of heat in TV studios, no major riots in past 10 yrs in India: Sadhguru
165.article_body: There is "a lot of heat" in television studios which suggests there is rising religious intolerance in country, Sadhguru said. He added, we haven't heard of any major communal riots in India in past 10 years. "These things have come down significantly in last 25 years," Sadhguru said. "I think we tend to exaggerate things quite a bit," he stated.

166.title: Boney has helped me, gave me 'Wanted' when time was not in my favour: Salman
166.article_body: Salman Khan, during the International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA) in Abu Dhabi, credited producer Boney Kapoor for reviving his career with the film 'Wanted'. "Boney Kapoor has helped me throughout my life. When the time was not in my favour, he gave me 'Wanted', which got me back," he said. The film, directed by Prabhudheva, was released in 2009.

167.title: Sub-inspector sexually exploits stepdaughter, wife's sister in B'luru; booked
167.article_body: A sub-inspector has been booked for allegedly sexually exploiting his 13-year-old stepdaughter and his wife's sister in Bengaluru. The second wife, who'd filed a complaint against the accused, claimed that he had also forced her to have unnatural sex. The complainant said that she and the accused initially had a "harmonious life" after marriage, but it "deteriorated as times passed".

168.title: Political alliances can't be one-sided: Milind Deora on BMC wards reservation
168.article_body: After 21 of the 29 wards held by Congress were reserved for women for the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation election, Congress leader Milind Deora has expressed his disappointment. "The greatest casualty of BMC's ward reservation has been Congress, despite being an MVA ally. Political alliances cannot be one-sided. I will raise this issue...with the party's leadership," Deora said.

169.title: BJP pushed India into dark age of religious polarisation: Congress
169.article_body: A day after Gulf countries condemned now suspended BJP spokesperson's remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Congress said that "the BJP has pushed India into a dark age of religious polarisation". It said that the BJP's statement, saying it is against any ideology which insults any religion, is farce and a sham attempt at damage control.

170.title: No rule of law in state, only a ruler: WB Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar
170.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar said he has seen a situation where there is no rule of law in the state but a "ruler". "I've seen terrible situations and challenges being a Governor. I've seen the rule going beyond the constitutional system," Dhankhar added. Furthermore, Dhankhar said the rule in West Bengal doesn't match the standards of a democratic setup.

171.title: Surat set to get India's 1st bullet train station, to be ready by 2024
171.article_body: India's first bullet train station will come up in Gujarat's Surat. The station will be completed by 2024, reports said. Minister for Railways, Ashwini Vaishnaw, visited the site on Monday to review the progress of the project. "We are trying our best to start bullet train services between Surat and Billimora in 2026," Vaishnaw said.

172.title: Viswanathan Anand defeats world chess champion Magnus Carlsen in sudden death game
172.article_body: Former world chess champion Viswanathan Anand defeated world champion Magnus Carlsen in Armageddon (sudden death game) after their regular match ended in a draw in the Classical section in the Norway Chess tournament. With the win, Anand regained the sole lead in the tournament. Earlier, Anand had defeated Carlsen in the seventh round of the blitz event of Norway Chess.

173.title: Brothers kill mother in Mumbai over not allowing marriage
173.article_body: A 42-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her two sons and the elder son's girlfriend in Mumbai's Wadala area for allegedly practising black magic and not allowing the elder son to marry his girlfriend. The elder son, Akshay (25), attacked his mother, Nirmala Thakur, with a sickle while his 15-year-old brother and girlfriend, Komal, were holding the deceased, police said.

174.title: Unwarranted & narrow-minded: India on Islamic nations' group's statement
174.article_body: India has categorically rejected Organisation of Islamic Cooperation Secretariat's "unwarranted and narrow-minded comments", adding that India accords the highest respect to all religions.
