"It's regrettable that OIC Secretariat has yet again chosen to make motivated, misleading and mischievous comments," India said. The OIC called upon the UN to take action against anti-Muslim practices in India.

175.title: They shouldn't take the risk of playing Hardik in ODIs: Ravi Shastri
175.article_body: Ravi Shastri said Hardik Pandya should play only T20Is before going into the T20 World Cup 2022. "Hardik has had ample rest and he will continue to have ample rest because that's the only format he should play going into the World Cup," he stated. "They shouldn't take the risk of making him play ODI cricket," he added.

176.title: Centre calling ex-BJP leaders 'fringe elements' is a joke: Cong MP
176.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh reacted to the Centre's response to Qatar and Kuwait demanding an apology over a former BJP spokesperson's remark on Prophet Muhammad, saying that the External Affairs Ministry "calling (former) BJP spokespersons 'fringe elements' is a joke". Moreover, he stated that BJP suspending Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal "is what Americans call a good cop-bad cop routine".

177.title: Why should India apologise for hate speeches of BJP bigots: KTR
177.article_body: A day after BJP suspended two spokespersons, Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal, over remarks on Prophet Muhammad amid condemnation by Gulf countries, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said the party, not the country, should apologise. "PM Narendra Modi Ji, why should India as a country apologise to international community for the hate speeches of BJP bigots?" he tweeted.

178.title: Gunpowder for toy gun pallets suspected to be cause of Hapur blast: Victim
178.article_body: A victim of the Hapur factory blast said that gunpowder that was being used for the pallets of toy guns in the factory is suspected to have caused the explosion. However, police said that the material that caused the blast would be ascertained after the Forensic Science Laboratory investigation. Police added that plastic pallets have been recovered from the site.

179.title: I'm going to be in Wimbledon if my body is ready: Rafael Nadal
179.article_body: After winning his 22nd Grand Slam, Rafael Nadal has said that he will be a part of the Wimbledon if his body is ready. "Wimbledon is not a tournament that I want to miss. I think nobody wants to miss Wimbledon. I love Wimbledon," he stated. Nadal defeated Casper Ruud 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 to win the French Open on Sunday.

180.title: Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket achievable for Root: Mark Taylor
180.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Mark Taylor has said that Sachin Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket is very much achievable for England's Joe Root. "Root has a minimum of five years left in him...[and] he's in the prime of his career, so there are 15,000-plus runs for him if he stays healthy," added Taylor. Tendulkar scored 15,921 Test runs.

181.title: PM Modi has weakened environmental laws in India: Jairam Ramesh
181.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has accused PM Narendra Modi of weakening environmental and forest laws in India. "Vishguru is launching LiFE (Lifestyle for Environment)," Ramesh said. "This is maximum hypocrisy since he's (PM Modi) weakening all environmental and forest laws, regulations, and institutions at home while posing as an eco-champion on the world stage," Ramesh added.

182.title: Chris Evans, Jennifer Lopez walk red carpet at MTV Movie & TV Awards 2022
182.article_body: Chris Evans, Jennifer Lopez and Olivia Rodrigo were among the celebrities who walked the red carpet at the MTV Movie & TV Awards, which took place on Sunday at the Barker Hangar in Santa Monica. Jennifer, who was honoured with the Generation Award at the event, opted for a black dress and accessorised her look with a necklace and bracelet.

183.title: Salman Khan's security strengthened after receiving threat letter
183.article_body: Salman Khan's security has been strengthened by the Maharashtra Home Department after a threat letter was sent to him and his father Salim Khan on Sunday. As per the police, the threat letter was found by Salim's security staff on a bench. Salman's security was earlier stepped up after it emerged that Lawrence Bishnoi was involved in Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

184.title: Those who express bigotry should be aware of consequences: Tharoor on Nupur's remarks
184.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said, "Those who express bigotry at home should be aware of the consequences abroad." He was reacting to reports claiming that superstores in Saudi Arabia, Kuwait and Bahrain removed Indian products over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. India's proud position is being undermined by the irresponsibility of the communal-minded, he added.

185.title: I'm living the life I'd never imagined: Arjun on his acting career
185.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, speaking about his acting career, said, "I'm living the life that I'd never imagined...I'm grateful...forever happy being part of this profession." He further stated he's aware of how difficult filmmaking is behind the camera. Arjun added, "The biggest lesson I learned over the years is that being in front of...camera is also as much of the hard work."

186.title: Imran Khan will be arrested once his protective bail expires: Pak Minister
186.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah has said that former PM Imran Khan will be arrested once his three-week transit bail granted by a court on June 2 expires. He said that Khan is facing over two dozen cases including rioting, sedition, chaos and armed attacks. Khan had earlier called for mass agitation demanding early elections in the country.

187.title: People wanted to know who I was dating even if I'd biggest film coming: Nargis
187.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri said that people always wanted to know who she is dating even when her biggest film was coming out. She said that people were interested in what she was doing even when she was not in India. "I don't know if they hound other people so much," Nargis said, adding that she is not a secretive human.

188.title: S Korea, US fire 8 missiles in response to N Korean missile tests
188.article_body: South Korea and the US fired eight surface-to-surface missiles on Monday in response to North Korea launching at least eight suspected ballistic missiles, according to authorities. South Korean military said that this was done to show the "capability and posture to launch immediate precision strikes on the origins of provocation and their command and support forces", Yonhap news agency reported.

189.title: Focus is not on breaking Shoaib Akhtar's fastest delivery record: Umran
189.article_body: India's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik, who has received his maiden Team India call-up for the South Africa T20Is, has said his focus is on bowling in the right areas and help the team win. "My focus is not on Shoaib Akhtar's fastest delivery record," he added. Akhtar bowled the fastest delivery in recorded history after clocking 161.3kmph in 2003.

190.title: The way BJP is working, country heading towards civil war: Lalu Yadav
190.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav on Sunday said that the way BJP is working, the country is moving towards a "civil war". "I call upon the people to unite against inflation, unemployment and corruption in the country," Yadav added. "We've to fight united and we'll win…We do not have to back off," he stated.

191.title: People said, 'You'll disappear off map': Nargis on her break from acting
191.article_body: Nargis Fakhri, speaking about her break from acting, said, "There came a point when I had to ask myself, 'Why am I working...hard when I can't even enjoy the fruits of my labour?'" She added, "People were like...'You'll...disappear off the map'." Nargis said she is happy she took the break as she wasn't scared into continuing in "that rat race".

192.title: Punjab Police detain Devendra alias Kala from Haryana in Sidhu Moosewala murder case
192.article_body: Punjab Police have detained Devendra alias Kala from Haryana's Fatehabad district last night in singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder case. According to reports, Devendra allegedly provided shelter to two other murder suspects, Charanjeet and Keshav. Earlier, Punjab Police had arrested Pawan Bishnoi and Naseeb from Fatehabad district.

193.title: Chinese astronauts reach space station to finish its construction
193.article_body: Three Chinese astronauts, launched into space on Sunday, successfully reached the Tiangong space station. They have been sent to complete the construction of the space station. They will spend six months at the station, which is expected to be complete by the end of 2022. They will assemble two laboratory modules that will join the main Tianhe living space.

194.title: Salman breaks down recalling how Suniel Shetty helped him when he didn't have any money
194.article_body: Actor Salman Khan broke down at IIFA Awards recalling how Suniel Shetty helped him when he didn't have any money. Salman said that he visited Suniel's shop and could afford only a pair of jeans. Salman added Suniel gifted him a shirt and later took him home and gave him a pair of boots he was eyeing at the shop.

195.title: How does the World Test Championship points table read after England's win?
195.article_body: Following their victory against New Zealand at Lord's, England are placed eighth on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 19.23% of points won. Bangladesh are placed last on the table with 16.67% of points won. Meanwhile, New Zealand are placed seventh, while India are third on the points table, which is led by Australia.

196.title: Heat wave warning issued for 11 states/UTs for today and tomorrow, list released
196.article_body: The IMD has issued heat wave warning for 11 states and UT/s for today and tomorrow. Heat wave conditions are likely in Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh and Telangana today, the IMD said. Meanwhile, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand and Odisha are likely to witness heat wave conditions today and tomorrow, the IMD added.

197.title: What has Kejriwal done for Kashmiri Pandits in Delhi?: Anurag Thakur
197.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday asked, "What has Arvind Kejriwal (Delhi CM and AAP national convenor) done for Kashmiri Pandits in Delhi?" His statement came after Kejriwal said BJP can’t handle Kashmir. "He does not believe in the atrocities on Kashmiri Pandits and takes support from Khalistani supporters to form a government in Punjab," Thakur added.

198.title: People asked me if I sniff cocaine in real since Aashram scene: Adhyayan
198.article_body: Actor Adhyayan Suman, speaking about his role in the 'Aashram' series, said it was similar to that of Shahid Kapoor in 'Udta Punjab'. However, he added he didn't want to "ape" Shahid in any way. He further revealed, "People have even asked me whether I sniff cocaine in real life since that scene of mine in the 'Aashram' series became...popular!"

199.title: Pro-Khalistan slogans, Bhindranwale posters raised outside Golden Temple
199.article_body: A group of people gathered at the entrance of the Golden Temple in Punjab's Amritsar and raised pro-Khalistan slogans on the anniversary of Operation Bluestar on Monday. The group also carried  posters of Khalistani separatist Jarnail Bhindranwale. Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann had last week reviewed the law and order situation in the state ahead of the Operation Bluestar anniversary.

200.title: Rapes have come down because PM Modi gave women toilets: Sambit Patra
200.article_body: BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra said that rapes have come down in many states because Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave toilets to women. He reportedly said that rapes happened when women in rural areas used to go out to attend nature's call in the dark. "Modi is the first Prime Minister in the world who talked about toilets," he added.

201.title: 'Always' actor Brad Johnson dies due to COVID-19 complications
201.article_body: Actor Brad Johnson, known for his role in Steven Spielberg's romantic drama 'Always', has passed away aged 62. His representative Linda McAlister told The Hollywood Reporter that Brad died of complications from COVID-19 on February 18 in Fort Worth, Texas. "He lived life to the fullest and taught his children to do the same," his family said in a statement.

202.title: It is a trouble-engine not double-engine govt in Bihar: Tejashwi
202.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday criticised CM Nitish Kumar-led NDA government in Bihar, saying, "Some...say it's a double-engine government in Bihar. But it's a trouble-engine government."  In Bihar, inflation is high, farmers are in "distress" and "no one talks about labourers and unemployment", he claimed. RJD is the only regional party that hasn't "compromised" with BJP, he also claimed.

203.title: We respect him a lot, truly unbelievable: Williamson on Root's 10,000 Test runs
203.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has praised Joe Root for taking England "over the line" in the first Test at Lord's. "It was a fantastic game, finely balanced...[and] Joe took them over the line. Absolutely (we respect him a lot in New Zealand). Truly unbelievable achievement (10,000 Test runs)," stated Kane. Root smashed his 26th Test hundred in the game.

204.title: Mandy Moore expecting second child with husband Taylor Goldsmith
204.article_body: American singer-actress Mandy Moore took to Instagram to share that she is expecting her second child with husband Taylor Goldsmith. She shared a picture of her son August Harrison Goldsmith wearing a t-shirt with 'big brother' printed on it. "Baby Boy Goldsmith #2 coming this fall...Gus is [going to] be the BEST big brother," Mandy wrote.

205.title: India reports 4,518 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 25,782
205.article_body: India has reported 4,518 COVID-19 cases, 2,779 recoveries and 9 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,270 COVID-19 cases and 15 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 25,782, while the death toll reached 5,24,701.

206.title: Who is Nupur Sharma, whose remarks made 3 nations call Indian envoys?
206.article_body: Former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma is a graduate in economics from Delhi University's Hindu College and also studied LLB from DU before completing her Master's degree in law from the London School of Economics. In 2008, she won the post of Delhi University Students' Union President. In 2015 Delhi Assembly election, she lost to Arvind Kejriwal from New Delhi constituency.

207.title: Only ICMR-accredited labs to conduct COVID-19 tests: DDMA
207.article_body: The Delhi Disaster Management Authority has directed that only ICMR-accredited labs can collect samples for COVID-19 tests in the national capital. "The personnel being employed by labs should be adequately qualified as per the qualifications fixed by ICMR/NABL or any authorised agency," said DDMA. It also directed the district magistrates to conduct surprise inspections of labs.

208.title: 2 players get retired out in same T20 match for the first time in history
208.article_body: The T20 Blast 2022 match between Birmingham Bears and Nottinghamshire marked the first instance of two players getting retired out in the same T20 match. The match which was reduced to eight-overs-a-side game saw Birmingham Bears' Carlos Brathwaite retiring out for 17(11) ahead of the last over. Meanwhile, Nottinghamshire's Samit Patel was retired out for 2(2).

209.title: French Open final vs Nadal is something I'll tell my grandkids about: Casper Ruud
209.article_body: Casper Ruud, who lost the French Open final against Rafael Nadal, has said he'll remember the match for the rest of his career and tell his grandkids about it. "I wish I could make the match closer...but at the end of the day...I'm going to enjoy this moment for a long time," he added. Nadal defeated Casper 6-3, 6-3, 6-0.

210.title: We've some people in TMC who pass on information to us: WB BJP chief
210.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said his party has some people in TMC who pass on information to them. "In fact, every party plants its men in other parties to remain privy to crucial decisions taken by its political opponents," he added. Reacting to his remark, TMC's Kunal Ghosh said, "No one believes what he (Majumdar) says now."

211.title: Noida woman cheated of ₹2.64 lakh by man she met on social media
211.article_body: A Noida woman was allegedly cheated of ₹2.64 lakh by a man, claiming to be German, she befriended on social media. He said he would meet her in Goa. Later, he claimed to have been detained by customs officials for carrying 50,000 pounds in cash meant for her. The woman was then asked to pay for his release.

212.title: I'm doing exactly what other heroines are doing today: Ankita Lokhande
212.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande said that she is confident about herself and added that it doesn't matter if she does a big film or not. "I'm doing today exactly what other heroines are doing, I'm looking as well, dressing in the same clothes, I'm a good actor and dancer too," she stated. "I'm...confident about myself, I don't need people," she added.

213.title: Twitter user shares video of men wheeling on B'luru road, police respond
213.article_body:
A Twitter user shared a video of two men on a scooty, wheeling in Bengaluru. "@BlrCityPolice
wheeling between Hosakerehalli and Somapura on NICE road this afternoon. What was also unfortunate was [that] just 5 kms from this place, there was an interceptor catching speeding vehicles and it appears these guys were fully aware," the tweet read.

214.title: Pune's SPPU to get ₹10 crore to build pool, other facilities
214.article_body: The Maharashtra government has allocated ₹10 crore to Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) to build infrastructure and sports facilities, including a swimming pool. The fund will also be used to develop a memorial of the leader, Savitribai Phule. Announcing the decision, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that all necessary help to upgrade the sports complex in SPPU will be given.

215.title: Dad got letters saying 'Want to marry you' after mom's death: Nargis' daughter
215.article_body: Late actors Sunil Dutt and Nargis' daughter Priya Dutt said after her mother Nargis passed away, her father got letters from women saying they want to marry him and that they would take care of his children. "Once we told him, 'Dad if you like someone...it's okay...We will understand'...He laughed and said, 'I haven't found...anyone like your mother'," Priya added.

216.title: Govt plans to revamp New Delhi Railway Station on its own: Report
216.article_body: The Centre is reportedly planning to undertake the New Delhi Railway Station's revamp project completely by themselves instead of doing it under the PPP model. A ₹4,700 crore plan is currently undergoing evaluation where the Centre is looking to directly fund the Engineering Procurement and Construction contracts. Notably, a six-floor station complex is planned as part of the redevelopment.

217.title: B'luru reports 1st COVID-19 death in June as new cases rise to 291
217.article_body: Bengaluru recorded 291 new coronavirus cases and one death on Sunday, according to BBMP data. This is the first death reported in June due to the virus. The number of active clusters in the city is currently 12, while the positivity rate is 1.62%, the data showed. The city reported 142 recoveries the same day, the data also showed.

218.title: He wanted Broad to go and have a slog: Stokes on McCullum's strategy vs NZ
218.article_body: After winning the first Test against New Zealand, England Test captain Ben Stokes revealed that head coach Brendon McCullum wanted Stuart Broad to bat if Joe Root or Ben Foakes had lost their wicket during their chase of NZ's 277-run target. "That's the kind of stuff that we're not used to in the dressing room," Stokes added.

219.title: Duo attacks man over suspected affair with one of their ex-girlfriends in Pune
219.article_body: Two men, aged 24 and 25, allegedly attacked a 20-year-old man with sharp weapons on suspicion that the latter was having an affair with one of the duo's former girlfriends in Pune, according to the police. One accused was arrested, while the police are looking for the other. The victim was taken to a hospital and his condition is stable.

220.title: Centre in denial, wants everyone to pretend all is well in J&K: Farooq
220.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said the central government is living in "denial" and it wants everyone to keep their heads down and pretend all is well in Kashmir, including Kashmiri Pandits. Speaking about the recent incidents of violence in the Valley, Abdullah said, "They (central government) want to project normalcy to the world when it is the exact opposite."

221.title: Hire for real tech skills with Scaler Enterprise: Scaler
221.article_body: EdTech startup, Scaler, launches a hiring portal, Scaler Enterprise, with a campaign highlighting the importance of real tech skills. It aims to aid CTOs, Senior Engineers, and Recruiters in finding problem-solvers who are fit to scale their product, said Scaler. It added that it is key to look beyond hiring biases to build a team with top tech potential.

222.title: Saudi Arabia condemns ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad
222.article_body: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia has said in a statement that it expresses its condemnation of the statements made by the former BJP spokesperson, Nupur Sharma, insulting Prophet Muhammad. Earlier, Qatar, Kuwait and Iran summoned Indian ambassadors to condemn Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Mohammed.

223.title: Ronaldo's mother tears up as he scores goal for Portugal, pics go viral
223.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's mother teared up after he scored a goal for Portugal against Switzerland in a Nations League match. Pictures of Ronaldo's mother getting emotional in the stands have gone viral. Ronaldo scored two goals in the match as Portugal beat Switzerland 4-0. Ronaldo has now scored 117 goals in international football.

224.title: I was shocked that he didn't run: Riyan Parag on giving 'death stare' to Ashwin
224.article_body: Opening up on giving a 'death stare' to Ravichandran Ashwin after getting run out against GT in IPL 2022 Qualifier 1, Riyan Parag said, "It would've been fine if Ashwin was batting with tail-ender. He should run when I'm batting. I was shocked." He added, "Later, Ashwin came to me and said sorry because he was thinking something...and didn’t run."

225.title: Pune's Rohan Pethe bags 5th rank in UPSC, to join Indian Air Force
225.article_body: Pune resident Rohan Pethe bagged the fifth rank in the Combined Defence Services Examination conducted by the UPSC. He has been selected to join the flying branch of the Indian Air Force. A final year engineering student from Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, Pethe will be the third-generation officer from his family to join the military.

226.title: ED raids Satyendar Jain's home in alleged money laundering case
226.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted searches at residence of Delhi's Health Minister Satyendar Jain in connection with hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company. Jain was arrested in the case on May 30. CBI had earlier alleged that Jain and his family set up four shell firms to launder ₹11.78 crore in 2010-12 and ₹4.63 crore in 2015-16.

227.title: 8 water ATMs in Pune Cantonment area lying defunct since 2019
227.article_body: A total of eight water ATMs installed in eight wards of Pune Cantonment area in 2016-17 are lying defunct since past three years. "Due to lack of timely service and attention by [Pune Cantonment Board (PCB)], these ATMs have become defunct," a resident said. Some components need to be changed otherwise it'll affect water quality, said PCB CEO Subrat Pal.

228.title: Fake intl call centre cheating US citizens busted in Delhi; 4 arrested
228.article_body: A fake international call centre operating in Delhi, which allegedly cheated US citizens on the pretext of providing them with technical support from Microsoft, has been busted and four people have been arrested. Police said the accused cheated their targets by inducing them to pay money for solving a non-existent problem. They sometimes also made their targets buy gift cards.

229.title: Rafael Nadal and French Open, the romance continues: Ojha
229.article_body: Taking to Twitter following world number five Rafael Nadal's record-extending 14th French Open win on Sunday, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha wrote, "Nadal and French Open, the romance continues." Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag tweeted, "King of clay. What a Champion. Nadal. Number 14 at Roland Garros." Roger Federer's coach Ivan Ljubicic said, "There is no word to describe this feat."

230.title: Winning 14th French Open title is amazing, means everything: Nadal
230.article_body: Talking about his record-extending 14th French Open title, 36-year-old Rafael Nadal said it's "amazing" and means everything. "Much more probably emotional than the first time because [it's] completely unexpected to be where I am at this age, at this stage of my career." It's Nadal's 22nd Grand Slam title. At 19, he won the 2005 French Open on his debut.

231.title: Russian plane's detention in Sri Lanka is private legal issue: PM
231.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has informed Russia that the detention of an Aeroflot aircraft in Colombo is a private legal matter. The Russian flag carrier has suspended flights to Sri Lanka in response. Reportedly, a company owning the plane claimed that Aeroflot had continued to fly the aircraft despite the lease agreement between them being terminated in March.

232.title: A modern day Hercules: Shastri to Nadal on his 14th French Open win
232.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal's record-extending 14th French Open title, Ravi Shastri tweeted, "A modern day Hercules who just will not melt in...hottest claypot. Starts favourite to make it 15 only. Just insane. Salute forever." Nadal's 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 win over eighth-seeded Casper Ruud gave him a record-extending 22nd Grand Slam title. Nadal is now 112-3 win-loss lifetime at Roland Garros.

233.title: Salman's father found threat letter on bench where he sits daily: Police
233.article_body: The threat letter sent to actor Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan was found by the latter on a bench where he sits daily after jogging, police said. Salim Khan found the letter at 7.30-8.00 am on Sunday morning near Bandra Bandstand Promenade in Mumbai, police added. An FIR against an unknown person has been filed.

234.title: Ankita, Vicky crowned winners of Smart Jodi, win ₹25-lakh cash prize
234.article_body: Smart Jodi contestants Ankita Lokhande and Vicky Jain were announced as the winners of the show on Sunday. They took home a 'golden gathbandhan' frame and a ₹25 lakh cash prize. Comedian Balraj and his wife, singer Deepti, were announced as the first runners-up. The Star Plus show which lasted eight weeks, was hosted by Maniesh Paul.

235.title: After Qatar & Kuwait, Iran summons Indian envoy over BJP leader's remark against Prophet
235.article_body: After Qatar and Kuwait, Iran has also summoned the Indian ambassador to condemn and reject a BJP leader's remarks against Prophet Mohammed. The state media called it an "insult against Prophet of Islam in an Indian TV show". This comes ahead of Iranian Foreign Minister's first-ever trip to India next week.

236.title: Joe Root becomes joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 Test runs, breaks Sachin's record
236.article_body: Former England captain Joe Root has become the joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 runs in Test cricket. Root completed 10,000 runs in Test cricket at the age of 31 years and 157 days, equalling Alastair Cook's record. He overtook Sachin Tendulkar, who had reached the 10,000-run mark at the age of 31 years and 326 days.

237.title: Look into this: FM to LIC as 17-yr-old orphan gets notices to repay ₹29 lakh loan
237.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked LIC to look into the matter of a 17-year-old orphan girl receiving legal notices from the state-run insurer to repay ₹29 lakh on a home loan taken by her father. Vanisha lost both her parents to COVID-19 during the second wave. LIC has blocked her father's savings as Vanisha is a minor, TOI reported.

238.title: Spain to deliver anti-aircraft missiles & tanks to Ukraine: Report
238.article_body: Spain will supply anti-aircraft missiles and tanks to Ukraine as it seeks to boost its military support to the country, according to government sources cited by a local newspaper. Spain will also provide essential training to Ukraine's military in how to use the tanks, it claimed. Spain has supplied ammunition, individual protection equipment and light weapons to Ukraine so far.

239.title: VP Naidu launches India-Qatar Start-Up bridge in Doha
239.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday launched the "India-Qatar Start-Up bridge" at the India-Qatar Business Forum in Doha to link the startup ecosystems of the two countries. "We have now a very robust India-Qatar economic partnership and it's getting enriched with each passing day," Naidu said. Number of Indian businesses in Qatar has also increased, he added.

240.title: Swiatek's reaction after seeing Robert Lewandowski in French Open final crowd goes viral
240.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek's reaction after seeing footballer Robert Lewandowski in the French Open women's singles final crowd has gone viral. The eventual winner Swiatek was visibly surprised to see Lewandowski. "He has been a top athlete in our country for so many years...it's hard to believe that he came to watch me. Just overawed," Swiatek said.

241.title: 4 injured as clash erupts between 2 groups in Gujarat's Surendranagar
241.article_body: At least four persons were injured in a clash between two upper-class groups in Gujarat's Surendranagar on Sunday, police said. According to a villager, the clash broke out over a dispute on passing through a road between two-three fields. As per reports, one of the groups also attacked a house nearby and broke vehicles parked there.

242.title: Huge inspiration for sporting world: ABD on Nadal's record 14th French Open
242.article_body: After Rafael Nadal beat eighth-seeded Casper Ruud to win a record-extending 14th French Open, AB de Villiers said the Spaniard is a "huge inspiration for the sporting world!" He added, "I hope all youngsters were watching, especially...pre and post match respect between opponents and to the sport." The 36-year-old has also claimed a men's all-time record 22nd Grand Slam title.

243.title: Thai Police rescue 59 Rohingya refugees from island near Malaysia
243.article_body: The police in Thailand on Sunday said that they had rescued 59 Rohingya refugees who had been abandoned by people smugglers from a Thai island near Malaysia. "The boat driver told them they had arrived in Malaysia and left them on the island a few days ago," they added. The refugees include 23 women and five children.

244.title: Police insert stick in UP man's rectum, give electric shocks; pay him ₹100 later
244.article_body: Five policemen have been booked in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun for allegedly torturing a man they arrested in connection with cattle slaughter case. The victim's mother said the policemen shoved a stick inside the man's rectum and gave him repeated electric shocks. She added that policemen paid him ₹100 before releasing him after they realised they arrested the wrong person.

245.title: BJP becoming 'Cong-yukt': AAP after 4 ex-Punjab Cong ministers join BJP
245.article_body: AAP on Sunday said BJP which used to talk about a "Congress-mukt Bharat (Congress-free India)" is itself becoming "Congress-yukt (filled with Congress)". This comes a day after four former Punjab Congress ministers joined BJP. AAP leader Malvinder Singh Kang also accused BJP of double standards, stating that it welcomed many Congress leaders against whom it had levelled several charges earlier.

246.title: Ranveer, Salman & Aamir attend Ambani event hosted for Anant's fiancee Radhika
246.article_body: Actors Ranveer Singh, Salman Khan and Aamir Khan were seen at an Arangetram event hosted by Nita and Mukesh Ambani for their son Anant Ambani's fiancee Radhika Merchant on Sunday. The event is traditionally hosted for the debut dance performance of a trained Bharatanatyam dancer. Ambanis hosted the event at Jio World Centre in Mumbai.

247.title: 'Mr Dependable' Root, what a player: Stokes on England's 1st Test win vs NZ
247.article_body: Following England's five-wicket win against New Zealand in first Test, England captain Ben Stokes said no one had the upper hand and the way his side handled pressure in fourth innings on a "difficult" wicket at Lord's was fantastic. "And obviously 'Mr dependable', Joe Root, stood up. Scoring a hundred and 10,000 runs- what a player...what a man," he added.

248.title: Delhi's maximum temperature reaches 47°C for 2nd straight day
248.article_body: The maximum temperature reached 47°C in Delhi's Mungeshpur for the second consecutive day on Sunday amid a heatwave in the national capital, the India Meteorological Department said. Jafarpur, Najafgarh, Ridge and Pitampura observatories recorded over 45°C. On Saturday, the highest maximum temperature in Delhi was recorded at Mungeshpur at 47.1°C.

249.title: Fringe elements' view, not our govt's: India to Kuwait over BJP leader's remark on Prophet
249.article_body: After Kuwait condemned BJP leader's remarks on Prophet Mohammed and sought India's apology, Indian embassy in Kuwait released a statement, saying that the offensive tweets were fringe elements' view. "The tweets do not, in any manner, reflect the views of the Government of India...Strong action has been taken," India stated. BJP suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal over remarks.

250.title: Unseeded Garcia-Mladenovic win their 2nd French Open title as a team
250.article_body: Unseeded French pair of Caroline Garcia and Kristina Mladenovic have clinched their second French Open women's doubles title together. The 2016 champions defeated eighth seeds Coco Gauff and Jessica Pegula of America 2-6, 6-3, 6-2 in final on Sunday. Overall, this is Mladenovic's fourth French Open women's doubles title, having won it in 2019 and 2020 alongside Hungary's Timea Babos.

251.title: Indian Railways cancelled nearly 9,000 train services this year
251.article_body: The Indian Railways cancelled nearly 9,000 train services this year, according to an RTI reply. Of these, more than 1,900 train services were cancelled from March to May for the movement of coal, the Railways said. The Railways also said that it had cancelled 6,995 train services for maintenance work or for construction purposes.

252.title: Gunmen kill 50 in attack on church in Nigeria: Lawmaker
252.article_body: At least 50 people have been killed in an attack by gunmen on a Catholic church in Nigeria's Ondo state during mass on Sunday, a lawmaker said. Local media said the gunmen had fired at worshippers and detonated explosives at the church. "I am deeply saddened by the unprovoked attack and killing of innocent people," the Governor of Ondo tweeted.

253.title: Our planet is one, but efforts have to be many: PM at 'LiFE Movement' launch
253.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday launched the 'Lifestyle for the Environment (LiFE) Movement' and said, "Our planet is one, but our efforts have to be many." "Mahatma Gandhi talked about a zero-carbon lifestyle. In our daily life choices, let us pick the most sustainable options," he added. "Let us follow the principle of reuse, reduce and recycle," the PM said.

254.title: Want to keep batting as long as I can: Root after 26th Test century
254.article_body: England batter Joe Root said he wants to bat as long as he can and win as many matches possible for his side following the hosts' five-wicket win against New Zealand in first Test at Lord's. "As long as I've got the energy...drive to do it, I'll do it," he added. Root (115*) hit his 26th century in the match.

255.title: Lebanon warns Israel against any aggression in disputed waters
255.article_body: Lebanon on Sunday warned Israel against any "aggressive action" in disputed waters where both countries hope to develop offshore energy. This comes after a storage and production ship arrived in the waters to produce gas for Israel on Sunday. Israel has claimed that the field in question is not in disputed waters but within its Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ).

256.title: PM Modi announces ₹2-lakh aid for 22 MP pilgrims killed in bus accident in U'khand
256.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his grief at the death of 22 pilgrims after their bus fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district on Sunday. PM Modi announced ₹2-lakh aid for the relatives of those killed and ₹50,000 for the injured persons. The bus was carrying 28 pilgrims from Madhya Pradesh's Panna district.

257.title: After Qatar, Kuwait seeks India's apology over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet
257.article_body: After Qatar, Kuwait on Sunday summoned Indian ambassador and handed him an official protest note expressing Kuwait's condemnation of the "insulting statements" against Prophet Mohammed "by one of the officials in India's ruling party". While welcoming the BJP leader's suspension, Kuwait said, "It demands a public apology for those hostile statements." BJP suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal.

258.title: Role in 'Chennai Express' wasn't great, did it for SRK: Sathyaraj
258.article_body: Actor Sathyaraj has spoken about his role in 2013 film 'Chennai Express' which featured Shah Rukh Khan, saying he felt it was "not that great a role" for him. The actor added that he conveyed it to director Rohit Shetty and also to Shah Rukh. "But I eventually did the film because I like Shah Rukh very much," Sathyaraj said.

259.title: Nadal becomes oldest French Open men's singles champ, clinches his 22nd Grand Slam title
259.article_body: Ex-world number one Rafael Nadal defeated world number eight Casper Ruud 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 in the Roland Garros 2022 final to win the French Open for a record-extending 14th time. With this, Nadal became the oldest player to win French Open men's singles title aged 36. The Spaniard has now won a record-extending 22 Grand Slam titles.

260.title: I see lots of curated negativity: Kangana on 'Dhaakad' performance
260.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut shared the screenshot of an article calling her "Box office queen of India" on Instagram Stories. She wrote alongside it, "2019 I gave 'Manikarnika'...super hit...2021 I gave...'Thalaivii' which came on OTT and was huge success." She further wrote, "I see lots of curated negativity but 2022 is the year of blockbuster 'Lock Upp'...And it's not over yet."

261.title: I was told not to do horror films so early in my career: Mugdha Godse
261.article_body: Actress-model Mugdha Veira Godse said things have changed in the industry from the time when she started. "When I had just joined, it was like if you have started with...film like 'Fashion' then you need to take up 'A' list films only," she added. "I was told ‘Why are you doing horror films so early in your career?'" Mugdha said.

262.title: France in talks with UAE to replace Russian oil supplies: Finance Min
262.article_body: France is in talks with the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to replace Russian oil purchases, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Sunday. "We have to find an alternative to Russian oil," he added. Notably, this comes after the European Union (EU) announced its decision to ban 90% of Russian crude oil imports by the end of the year.

263.title: 15 pilgrims dead after bus from MP falls into gorge in Uttarakhand
263.article_body: At least 15 people died and several others were injured after a bus carrying 28 pilgrims from Madhya Pradesh's Panna district fell into a gorge in Uttarkashi district of Uttarakhand on Sunday. Fifteen bodies have been recovered, Director General of Police Ashok Kumar said. The accident took place in the Damta area of Uttarkashi.

264.title: Chinese firms under govt probe for tax evasion collected Indians' data: Report
264.article_body: Chinese companies being probed for tax evasion in India were gathering personal data of Indians for senior Chinese Communist Party (CCP) members, according to a report by Economic Times. Many Chinese firms are directly or indirectly owned by senior CCP members, the report said. Several Chinese loan apps promised easy money and burdened users with hefty interest, the report added.

265.title: Overwhelmed at 'Shershaah' winning 6 IIFA awards: Karan Johar
265.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar celebrated Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani-starrer 'Shershaah' winning the highest number of awards at the 2022 IIFA awards with six victories. The filmmaker shared a list of the film's wins on social media, writing, "A major win at the #IIFA2022...Overwhelmed and PROUD to have painted this story for the world to watch & shower their unending love."

266.title: Qatar's investment in India has grown 5 times since March 2020: VP Naidu
266.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday met Qatar's PM and Interior Minister Sheikh Khalid bin Khalifa bin Abdulaziz Al Thani in Doha. He said, "Qatar's investment in India has grown five times since March 2020." Naidu added that it is still well below potential and can be substantially increased.

267.title: Aishwarya joins Abhishek in an impromptu dance at IIFA 2022, video goes viral
267.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan joined her husband, actor Abhishek Bachchan in an impromptu dance at the 22nd IIFA awards held in Abu Dhabi. In the video that surfaced online, the actor came down from the stage and was seen dancing with his family, Aishwarya and his daughter Aaradhya Bachchan. He is seen wearing a white sherwani in the video.

268.title: 7 girls drown while taking bath in check dam in Tamil Nadu
268.article_body: Seven girls, aged between 10 and 18, drowned at a check dam built across river Gadilam near Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore on Sunday. According to police, the incident took place when the group entered the water to take a bath and were washed away by a strong undercurrent in the deep end of the dam. CM MK Stalin has expressed grief.

269.title: Siraj called me, said 'You are a kid, behave like a kid': Parag on fight with Harshal
269.article_body: Referring to his fight with RCB's Harshal Patel in IPL 2022, RR's Riyan Parag said he made a hand gesture towards Harshal after hitting him for a six but didn't say anything. Parag added Harshal had made a similar gesture towards him in IPL 2021. Parag stated that Mohammed Siraj called him and said, "You're a kid...behave like a kid."

270.title: All time great: Ganguly on Root after his 10,000 runs in Test cricket
270.article_body: Reacting to England batter Joe Root completing 10,000 runs in Tests following his 115*(170) against New Zealand in first Test, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly took to Twitter and wrote, "Roooooooot...what a player what a knock under pressure...an all time great." Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Root has 10,000 Test runs. And he's just 31. Well played...congratulations." England won by five wickets.

271.title: Pakistan's PM seeks emergency plan to end load-shedding
271.article_body: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif on Saturday directed authorities to prepare an emergency plan to reduce load-shedding in the country. The load-shedding in various parts of the country has been creating problems for citizens, according to a report. Sharif has tasked a committee comprising of ministers for energy, petroleum and finance to present an actionable plan.

272.title: Salman Khan receives threat letter, FIR filed
272.article_body: Actor Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan received a threat letter on Sunday, Mumbai Police have said. An FIR has also been filed against an unknown person by Bandra Police and a further probe is underway, they added. Security was earlier increased around Salman's apartment after gangster Lawrence Bishnoi emerged as the prime suspect in Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

273.title: India responds after Qatar seeks govt's apology over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet
273.article_body: Indian Embassy has released a statement after Qatar summoned Indian ambassador and sought government's apology over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet Mohammed. "Ambassador conveyed that the [offensive] tweets don't...reflect the views of Government of India...Strong action has already been taken against those who made the derogatory remarks," it said. BJP suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal.

274.title: No other species can send life to Mars, humanity can't let them down: Musk
274.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted, "Humanity is life's steward, as no other species can transport life to Mars." The SpaceX CEO said that humanity can't let down the other species. He also revealed that his plan is to build over 1,000 Starship rockets to transport life to Mars. "Basically, (very) modern Noah's Arks," Musk added.

275.title: Tanks supplied by the West to Ukraine destroyed in airstrikes: Russia
275.article_body: Russia on Sunday said that it had destroyed tanks and armoured vehicles supplied to Ukraine by some eastern European countries during airstrikes on Kyiv, the first such strikes on the capital in weeks. The tanks and armoured vehicles were part of the military aid from the West. Notably, President Vladimir Putin has warned the West against supplying weapons to Ukraine.

276.title: Get well Shah Rukh: Mamata as reports say SRK tested COVID-19 positive
276.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee reacted to reports of the state's brand ambassador, actor Shah Rukh Khan, testing positive for COVID-19 and said, "(I) pray for the fastest recovery for the superstar." She added, "Get well Shahrukh! Spring back asap!" Actor Kartik Aaryan has tested positive for COVID-19 while reports said that actor Aditya Roy Kapur also tested positive.

277.title: We expect public apology from Indian govt: Qatar on BJP leader's remarks on Prophet
277.article_body: Qatar summoned Indian ambassador Deepak Mittal and handed him a note expressing disappointment, rejection and condemnation "to the controversial remarks made by an official in the ruling party in India against Prophet Mohammed". Welcoming BJP's decision to suspend the official, Qatar said it's "expecting a public apology and immediate condemnation of these remarks" from Indian government.

278.title: Jared Leto's 'Morbius' re-released in over 1,000 US theatres
278.article_body: Jared Leto-starrer 'Morbius' was re-released in over 1,000 theatres across the US after memes about the film's catchphrase "It's Morbin' Time!" went viral on social media. The film was first released on April 1 and had performed poorly at the box office. As per reports, the film only earned a total of $85,000 (almost ₹66 lakh) upon re-release on Friday.

279.title: Shocked & appalled by the insensitivity: Hrithik Roshan on Layer'r Shot's ads
279.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan reacted to the ads for body spray Layer'r Shot which have been accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape. Taking to Instagram, he wrote, "Shocked and appalled by the insensitivity of this commercial. How could the entire team associated with this project think this was ok to make and showcase? Kudos to...viewers for calling it out."

280.title: Youth arrested for lacing teenager's cold drink, raping her in Pune
280.article_body: Police in Pune have arrested a youth for allegedly raping a teenager whom he had befriended on social media. The youth had allegedly laced the survivor's cold drink with a sedative before committing the crime. The accused had also allegedly threatened to upload a video of the act online if she informed her parents and kept sexually abusing her.

281.title: Heatwave conditions in Gurugram to continue till June 9: IMD
281.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Gurugram and its adjoining areas will experience heatwave conditions till June 9. "People should take adequate precautions. Avoid going out during peak hours in the afternoon and stay hydrated," an IMD official said. The city on Saturday recorded a maximum temperature of 45.3 degrees Celsius.

282.title: Pune Police cracks at least 10 cases of thefts of MUV silencers
282.article_body: Pune Police has cracked at least 10 cases of thefts of silencers of multi-utility vehicles (MUV) for the extraction of valuable metallic dust from the catalytic converter of these units. A police team was probing multiple cases of such thefts. Police said the mixed dust of three metals is sold at ₹3,000 per gram in the illegal market.

283.title: England's most complete all-round batter of all time: Vaughan to Root
283.article_body: Praising Joe Root after he reached the 10,000-run mark in Tests, Michael Vaughan tweeted, "England's most complete all-round batter of all time...10,000 runs and to do it with a match winning 100 is incredible...Well done." Root achieved this landmark in England's five-wicket win against New Zealand in the first Test at Lord's. He scored 115*(170) in England's second innings.

284.title: Delhi court extends Lawrence Bishnoi's police custody for 5 days
284.article_body: A Delhi court on Sunday extended the police custody of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi in connection with the Arms Act case for five more days. He earlier withdrew his plea from the High Court seeking necessary security saying he apprehended a fake encounter by Punjab Police. The Delhi Police didn't mention singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder probe against Bishnoi.

285.title: Mumbai reports 961 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death; positivity rate at 10.94%
285.article_body: Mumbai has reported 961 fresh COVID-19 cases, 374 recoveries and one death in the last 24 hours. The city reported a positivity rate of 10.94%, while the number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 4,880. The overall growth rate of COVID-19 cases in the city between May 29 and June 4 was 0.057%.

286.title: 1st arrest made in Hapur factory explosion that claimed 13 lives
286.article_body: One of the main accused in the explosion at a factory in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur was arrested on Sunday. The accused, Wasim, had taken the factory on rent from its owner Dilshad Khan, police said, adding that raids are being conducted to arrest Khan. At least 13 people were killed and 21 others were injured in the incident on Saturday.

287.title: I withdraw my statement: Nupur as BJP suspends her for remarks on Prophet Muhammad
287.article_body: Nupur Sharma retracted her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, made during a TV debate on the Gyanvapi issue, after being suspended by the BJP on Sunday. "I have been attending TV debates for the past many days where our Mahadev was being insulted and disrespected continuously...I couldn't tolerate this continuous insult...and said some things in response to it," said Sharma.

288.title: Ammy Virk's 'Sher Bagga' postponed after Sidhu Moosewala's demise
288.article_body: Punjabi actor-singer Ammy Virk has announced that the release of his upcoming film 'Sher Bagga' has been postponed after singer Sidhu Moosewala's death. He shared a note on Instagram Stories, writing, "Due to extremely sad and unfortunate time, we are not in a state of mind to celebrate this art form." Sidhu was shot dead in Punjab on May 29.

289.title: Aus could go in with just one pacer in Tests vs Sri Lanka: Hazlewood
289.article_body: Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said his side could go into two-Test series against Sri Lanka with just one specialist pacer, given spin-friendly pitch in Galle. "We obviously know...three of us (Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc and himself) are going to play in most conditions...it's probably me who's a bit slower on airspeed who drops out on spinning wickets," he added.

290.title: IL&FS creditors to get ₹16,000 crore on pro-rata basis
290.article_body: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has approved the interim distribution of ₹16,361 crore to IL&FS creditors at the holding company level. The amount includes ₹11,296 crore in cash and ₹5,065 crore in Infrastructure Investment Trusts. The interim distribution "shall be implemented only after approval by the new board" and "shall take place [on] pro rata basis", NCLAT said.

291.title: 2 lower primary school students infected with norovirus in Kerala
291.article_body: Two lower primary school students in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram were found infected with norovirus, which is similar to diarrhoea-inducing rotavirus. It is suspected that the students got food poisoning from midday meals distributed at their school. At least 13 people at a veterinary college in Wayanad were infected with the virus in November last year.

292.title: They passed away without any suffering: AR Rahman on KK's demise
292.article_body: During an appearance at the IIFA awards, music composer AR Rahman spoke about the demise of singer KK. He said, "[It's] shocking! Actually, somebody going after a concert feels very shocking." "At the very same time, I also feel like it is so blessed. They were doing something they love and they passed away without any suffering," he added.

293.title: Gagging, is giving them publicity worse? Sona on Layer'r Shot ads
293.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra reacted to Layer'r Shot ads accused of promoting rape mentality, tweeting, "Gagging after I saw it here on my Twitter timeline & wondering if giving them additional publicity is worse." She further wrote, "The makers of the ad as well as the brand [need] to pay a hefty sum to a worthy cause; held accountable even commercially."

294.title: Actress Amy Jackson shares pic with rumoured boyfriend Ed Westwick
294.article_body: Actress Amy Jackson shared a picture with her rumoured boyfriend and Gossip Girl actor Ed Westwick on Instagram. In the picture, she's seen wearing a black top and posing with her arms around Ed. Last month, the paparazzi spotted Amy and Ed holding hands as they walked on a London street. Both of them were twinning in grey casuals.

295.title: 5 of family found hanging at their home in Bihar, forensic team called
295.article_body: Five members of a family, including two children aged eight and 10, were found hanging at their residence in Bihar's Samastipur on Sunday, police said, adding that the family was in debt. A relative of the deceased persons has alleged that her family members were murdered by money lenders. A Forensic Science Laboratory team has been called for an investigation.

296.title: Google disables RCS feature in India after businesses spam users with ads
296.article_body: Google is disabling Rich Communication Services (RCS) feature in India after reports emerged that users are being spammed with unwanted ads by businesses. "We are aware that some businesses are abusing our anti-spam policies to send promotional messages to users in India," Google said. RCS allows verified businesses to send messages, which include images and interactive features, to customers.

297.title: I'm not comfortable doing extremely bold scenes: Erica Fernandes
297.article_body: Actress Erica Fernandes said she isn't comfortable doing extremely bold scenes. "Some people are comfortable doing such scenes. But I am not. It matters to me to do things that I am comfortable with," she added. "Every second project that's coming my way or being made is mainly focused on the intimate part more than the story itself," she said.

298.title: 2 women, 4 minors beat disabled man to death in Mumbai
298.article_body: The police on Friday arrested two women and detained four minors on charges of killing a 51-year-old disabled man in Mumbai's Chembur. All six are accused of assaulting Prakash Waghmare with bamboo sticks on Thursday over his objection to his niece's relationship with one of the minors, according to the police. Waghmare had passed away at a hospital on Friday.

299.title: 400-year-old monastery destroyed in Russian attack, says Ukraine; releases video
299.article_body: A monastery that is around 400 years old has been destroyed in a Russian attack, Ukraine has said while releasing a video of the ancient building on fire. The 17th-century Svyatohirsk Lavra monastery is located near Russian positions in the eastern Donetsk region. It was first destroyed during the Soviet era and rebuilt later.

300.title: There's threat to my family: Nupur as her address is made public in BJP suspension letter
300.article_body: After being suspended from BJP amid controversy over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Nupur Sharma tweeted, "I request all media houses and everybody else not to make my address public. There is a security threat to my family." This comes after her suspension letter, which consisted of her address, was shared by various media houses and journalists.

301.title: When Arshdeep bowls at death, he keeps Dhoni and Hardik quiet: Irfan
301.article_body: Irfan Pathan has said pacer Arshdeep Singh was selected in India's 18-member squad for upcoming T20I series against South Africa due to his ability to keep the best batters "quiet". He added, "When he bowls at the death, he keeps MS Dhoni, Hardik Pandya quiet, bowls consistent yorkers against...set batters." Irfan further said that Arshdeep should play all five T20Is.

302.title: List of country-wise monkeypox cases released by WHO
302.article_body: The WHO has released the number of monkeypox cases reported in 27 non-endemic countries between May 13 and June 2. With total cases in these countries rising to 780, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland have the highest number of cases at 207. This is followed by Spain (156), Portugal (138), Canada (58), Germany (57) and France (33).

303.title: What did you do about Delhi's law & order in last 10 days: Atishi asks L-G
303.article_body: AAP MLA Atishi has accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena of "interfering" in the Delhi government's work and "conspiring" to derail democracy. "Today I want to ask him 'What have you done to improve the law and order situation in Delhi in the last 10 days?'," Atishi added. "L-G is acting like a dummy of the...central government," she said.

304.title: There is peace in my life: Vicky Kaushal post marriage with Katrina
304.article_body: During his appearance at the IIFA awards, actor Vicky Kaushal said his married life with his wife, actress Katrina Kaif is going good. Speaking about his life post marriage, Vicky said, "Sukoon bhari hai (there is a lot of peace) in his life." He further added that he's missing Katrina at the award show.

305.title: We'll hit new targets: Putin in warning to West on missile supply to Ukraine
305.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned of striking "those targets which we haven't yet been hitting" if the West supplies Ukraine with longer-range missiles, amid the war. This came after the US announced plans to give Ukraine precision HIMARS rocket systems. Putin said the "fuss" around weapon supplies from the West to Ukraine was 'designed to drag the conflict out'.

306.title: Conduct survey of Karnataka's Srirangapatna mosque in 25 days: VHP
306.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) has asked authorities in Karnataka's Mandya to conduct a survey at the Jamia mosque in Srirangapatna in 25 days to find out whether it had been a temple. This comes after members of various Hindutva outfits tried to enter the mosque but were stopped by police. VHP said it wanted to pray at the mosque.

307.title: WHO lists 5 key actions to prevent monkeypox
307.article_body: Amid rising monkeypox cases, WHO listed five key actions to prevent the disease. It suggested raising awareness about monkeypox and equipping countries to be able to recognise it. The second step is stopping human-to-human transmission using public health tools. Third step is protecting frontline workers. The next actions are utilising countermeasures like antivirals and accelerating research.

308.title: Delhi witnessed 2,300 accidents in first 5 months of 2022
308.article_body: Delhi saw 2,300 accidents which led to 505 deaths in the first five months of 2022, official data showed. Of these, 495 were fatal accidents and 1,762 were simple accidents. Outer north district, at 56, recorded the highest district-wise deaths, followed by northwest (50) and southwest (46) districts. Shahdara (16) reported least number of deaths, followed by central district (19).

309.title: Lata Mangeshkar never presented herself as a great singer: Arijit
309.article_body: Singer Arijit Singh, remembering late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar, said, "She never presented herself as...great singer, she always sang like a commoner." "She used to sing complex songs with such ease that it's amazing," Arijit said, adding, "When you listen to...song it seems like it's such an easy song but when you try singing it...you realise how difficult it is."

310.title: Root smashes 26th ton, completes 10,000 Test runs as Eng beat NZ by 5 wickets
310.article_body: England's Joe Root smashed his 26th hundred and reached 10,000 runs in Test cricket as England defeated New Zealand by five wickets in the first Test at Lord's. Root has now become the 14th player in cricket history and second from England to complete 10,000 Test runs. Root remained unbeaten at 115(170) as England chased down New Zealand's 277-run target.

311.title: BMC launches doorstep drive to speed up vaccination rate in Mumbai
311.article_body: The BMC has launched a drive to speed up the COVID-19 vaccination rate in the 12-17 age group and to increase booster dose intake among senior citizens in Mumbai. The drive is a part of the national 'Har Ghar Dastak 2.0' campaign. Only 28% of those in the 12-14 age group have taken the first dose, according to BMC data.

312.title: Congress appoints observers for 3 states ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
312.article_body: Congress on Sunday appointed senior leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Pawan Kumar Bansal, TS Singh Deo, Bhupesh Baghel and Rajeev Shukla as its central observers ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls.  Kharge has been appointed observer in Maharashtra, Bansal and Deo in Rajasthan and Baghel and Shukla in Haryana. These leaders will take the responsibility with immediate effect.

313.title: Rapper 50 Cent reshares Madonna's pics, compares her to aliens
313.article_body: Rapper 50 Cent reshared a picture shared by singer Madonna on social media along with a series of pictures of aliens. He wrote, "I hope she didn't make her kids take this picture. LOL at 63 somebody tell her to chill out please." In December, he had called her racy photos "the funniest sh*t" and later apologised for his comments.

314.title: Terence shares video of him dancing to KK's 'Such Keh...', says 'Gone too soon'
314.article_body: Choreographer Terence Lewis took to Instagram to pay tribute to KK, who passed away on May 31. He shared a video of himself dancing to Rehnaa Hai Terre Dil Mein's song 'Such Keh Raha Hai', which was sung by the late singer. "Gone Too Soon. KK you will live with us forever," Terence wrote with a broken heart emoji.

315.title: Maharashtra might be seeing 4th wave of COVID-19: Aaditya Thackeray
315.article_body: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said the state could be seeing the beginning of the fourth COVID-19 wave and urged citizens not to panic. "We're asking everyone to wear masks when stepping outdoors. We haven't made...masks mandatory, but will make it soon," he added. Aaditya appealed to the public to receive the booster dose of the vaccine on time.

316.title: I give a lot more money to climate change than Musk or anyone else: Gates
316.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in an interview said that he gives "a lot more money" to climate change than the world's richest person Elon Musk "or anyone else". Musk recently claimed that Gates has a "multi-billion dollar short position" against Tesla. Reacting to the claim, Gates said, "Somebody shorting...(Tesla) stock doesn't slow him down or hurt him in any way."

317.title: BJP suspends Nupur Sharma after her remarks on Prophet Muhammad
317.article_body: BJP has suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma from the party after her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad during a TV debate. The party has also suspended Delhi BJP's media in-charge Naveen Kumar Jindal. Notably, violence broke out in Kanpur in Uttar Pradesh on Friday after a Muslim organisation gave a call to shut shops over remarks made by Sharma.

318.title: 150 cr vaali smile sochni padegi: Kartik as 'Bhool...' earns ₹149 cr
318.article_body: Kartik Aaryan on Sunday retweeted film trade analyst Taran Adarsh's post about the box office figures of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. As per Adarsh, the horror-comedy film has earned ₹149.11 crore in India so far. Kartik wrote, "Kal 150 crore vaali smile sochni padegi." He had earlier shared a picture of himself smiling after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' crossed the ₹100-crore mark.

319.title: It probably looked like I was freaking out: Gauff on French Open final loss
319.article_body: Following her loss in the first Grand Slam final of her career at French Open, 18-year-old Coco Gauff said, "It probably looked like I was freaking out." She added, "But really, it was just [that] Iga Swiatek was too good." World number one Swiatek defeated 18th seed 6-1, 6-3 in one hour eight minutes on Saturday.

320.title: Bezos' Blue Origin flies 6 tourists to space in 5th crewed mission
320.article_body: Billionaire Jeff Bezos' space tourism venture Blue Origin completed its fifth crewed launch on Saturday after it flew six tourists into space for a 10-minute ride. The crew included Katya Echazarreta, the youngest American woman in space, and Victor Correa Hespanha, the second Brazilian to go into space, among others. The flight touched an altitude of approximately 106 kilometres.

321.title: First batch of 145 Haj pilgrims from J&K leaves for Saudi Arabia
321.article_body: The first batch of 145 Kashmiri pilgrims left for Saudi Arabia to perform the annual Haj pilgrimage, officials said on Sunday. The annual Haj pilgrimage resumed this year after being suspended for two years in view of the COVID-19 pandemic. Around 6,000 pilgrims from the Union Territory are scheduled to undertake the pilgrimage this year, according to the officials.

322.title: BBMP Chief Commissioner plants sapling on World Environment Day
322.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath on Sunday shared pictures of him planting a sapling during World Environment Day celebrations. One of the pictures shows Nath watering the sapling. He said that during the celebrations, which were held at the Independence Park in the city, saplings were also distributed to the public.

323.title: Late singer KK's song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' to release on June 6
323.article_body: Director Srijit Mukerji announced that late singer KK's song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' from upcoming film 'Sherdil' will release on June 6. Srijit wrote on Twitter, "Had already shared a video of Gulzar Saab and KK from this recording. Never imagined in my wildest dreams the first song of Sherdil will be released in his absence. Travel well, my friend."

324.title: Ukraine plans to restart domestic football leagues from August
324.article_body: Ukraine's football federation president Andriy Pavelko has revealed that they are planning to resume domestic football leagues in the country from August. "I spoke with our president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, about how important football is to distract...At all levels we will start in August," stated Pavelko. All leagues were stopped when Russia launched the invasion of the country in February.

325.title: You've respected me as a sister: Kangana on CM Yogi Adityanath's 50th b'day
325.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut shared a post for UP CM Yogi Adityanath on his 50th birthday. Taking to Instagram Stories, Kangana shared a photo of him and wrote, "An eminent leader and a source of inspiration. Someone who has always loved and respected me as a sister. Praying for Yogi's long life and [I] hope his glory shine throughout this world."

326.title: Want to teach school children once or twice a month: MP CM
326.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has expressed his desire to teach school children. He said, "We should...be ready to play the role of teacher. I also have a desire to visit school once or twice a month and teach children." The CM said this while inaugurating the Learnings from National Achievement Survey workshop at Kushabhau Thakre International Auditorium.

327.title: 8 students hospitalised after having midday meal in Kerala school
327.article_body: Eight students of a government upper primary school in Kerala's Alappuzha were hospitalised when they complained of uneasiness after having their midday meals. "We need to find out whether the food poisoning happened inside the school or not," a food safety official said. State Health Minister Veena George has asked the Food Safety Commissioner to look into the incident.

328.title: Biden plays song 'Butter' during BTS' White House visit; video surfaces
328.article_body: US President Joe Biden has shared a video of him playing South Korean band BTS' song 'Butter' during their visit to the White House on his social media handles. "I figured I'd make you feel at home," Biden said as he played the song. The K-pop group had met Biden last week to discuss the rise in anti-Asian hate crimes.

329.title: 3 kids out to play after lunch get trapped in car in Tamil Nadu, die
329.article_body: Three children aged seven, five and four died of suspected suffocation after they got trapped inside a car while they were playing after lunch on June 4. Reports said that the car's doors could only be opened from outside. The parents of the children found them lying unconscious inside the car and broke into the vehicle with help from passersby.

330.title: Wildfire spreads near Greek capital; houses, cars damaged
330.article_body: Buoyed by intense winds, a wildfire spread on the outskirts of the Greek capital Athens that damaged cars and houses, said the Fire Department. The authorities have ordered evacuation in parts of the Voula and Glyfada regions. More than 130 firefighters, six firefighting aircraft and four helicopters were deployed to control the fire.

331.title: Bhumi participates in a plantation drive in Nainital on World Environment Day
331.article_body: On the occasion of World Environment Day, Bhumi Pednekar planted saplings in Nainital, where she's shooting for her film 'The Ladykiller'. The actress, along with some children from NGO 'SOS Children's Villages of India', also planted saplings in pots that were painted by the children. "This planet is our only home...If we don't keep...[it] safe...we'll not be safe," Bhumi said.

332.title: When I entered stadium, it felt different: CSK's Simarjeet Singh on IPL debut
332.article_body: CSK pacer Simarjeet Singh, who made his IPL debut this season, has revealed that he was "extremely nervous" in his first game against SRH. "When I entered the stadium for the first time, it felt super different," he added. On playing under CSK captain MS Dhoni, Simarjeet said, "I learned how to be calm in pressure situations from Dhoni."

333.title: You did it: Lewandowski to Swiatek after her French Open title win
333.article_body: Taking to Instagram, footballer Robert Lewandowski congratulated Polish Tennis player Iga Swiatek after she won the French Open 2022. "What a match! Congratulations Swiatek, you did it," he wrote. Lewandowski attended the French Open final between Swiatek and Coco Gauff. "Lewandowski's been a top athlete in our country...it's hard to believe that he actually came to watch me," Swiatek stated.

334.title: Tunisian judges to strike for a week after Prez sacks 57 judges
334.article_body: Tunisian judges will hold a week-long strike from Monday and a sit-in protest after the country's President Kais Saied dismissed 57 judges over charges of corruption and protecting terrorists last week. Earlier in February, Saied had also dissolved the Supreme Judicial Council. "The attack was not only against judges, but on the law and freedoms," a judges' association head said.

335.title: RBI may use pics of Rabindranath Tagore, APJ Abdul Kalam on banknotes: Report
335.article_body: In a first, the Finance Ministry and the RBI are considering using watermark figures of Rabindranath Tagore and APJ Abdul Kalam on a new series of banknotes, as per a report. It added that two separate sets of Gandhi, Tagore and Kalam watermarks have been sent to IIT-Delhi Emeritus Professor Dilip T Shahani before a final presentation to the Centre.

336.title: Will summons in name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?: Shiv Sena
336.article_body: After ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' asked, "Will a few summons in the name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?" "In the National Herald case, the transaction was done to repay the loan and not for misconduct...Nehru started this newspaper in the year 1937," Shiv Sena added.

337.title: Man says 'local guy' plans to kill brother, shares video, Hyd Police respond
337.article_body: A Twitter user shared video of a man indulging in violence and said he is a "local guy" who has plans to kill the user's brother. He also shared screenshot of mail sent to Hyderabad Police officer regarding the matter. "We are suffering, please help us," the user wrote. Hyderabad Police tagged SHO Chaderghat and SHO Malakpet in their reply.

338.title: India's trade deficit widens to $23.33 bn in May, exports rise 15%
338.article_body: India's trade deficit widened to $23.33 billion in May 2022, compared with $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, as imports grew faster than exports. Merchandise exports rose 15.46% to $37.29 billion while imports grew 56.14% to $60.62 billion. While petroleum and crude oil imports rose 91.6% to $18.14 billion, coal imports rose to $5.33 billion in May 2022.

339.title: This was the first time I did intimate scene in any show: Anuritta on Aashram 3
339.article_body: Actress Anuritta K spoke about the pressure due to her show Ek Badnaam Aashram 3's popularity. "This was the first time I did an intimate scene in any...series," she said. "I feel once the series is popular and your character has received so much love, the responsibility increases. Prakash Jha sir was...clear what he wanted out of me," she added.

340.title: Salman Khan meets world's smallest singer, hugs him in viral video
340.article_body: The world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik posted a video on social media of meeting actor Salman Khan and singing 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha' for him. Abdu wrote alongside the video, "Jab Salman ko deka to esa laga jese apna koyee (When I saw Salman, it felt like someone my own)." Salman can be seen hugging Abdu in the viral video.

341.title: Australia says Chinese aircraft flew dangerously close to its own
341.article_body: Australia has accused a Chinese fighter aircraft of flying dangerously close to its plane during a routine surveillance activity in May. "The intercept resulted in a dangerous manoeuvre which posed a safety threat," said the government. Defence Minister Richard Marles said that the Chinese jet released a "bundle of chaff" containing aluminium pieces that went into the Australian aircraft's engine.

342.title: Documents link Kanpur violence mastermind with radical groups: Police
342.article_body: Police have come across documents linking the alleged mastermind of the Kanpur violence with radical groups, as per senior police officials. The documents were found with the key accused, including Zafar Hayat Hashmi, when they were arrested. Several people, including policemen, were injured in the clash on Friday.

343.title: 3 killed, 11 injured as multiple gunmen open fire on crowd in US' Philadelphia
343.article_body: Three people were killed and 11 were injured after multiple shooters opened fire into a crowd on a popular Philadelphia street, police said. Police officers were patrolling South Street, an area with many restaurants and bars, when "they observed several active shooters shooting into the crowd," Inspector D.F. Pace of the Philadelphia Police Department said.

344.title: I was sexually abused by family friend for 2.5 years as a teen, says Kubbra Sait
344.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait has revealed in her memoir that she was sexually abused by a friend of her parents when she was 17 years old. "I was being sexually abused and no one in my close perimeter could even tell," Sait wrote. She referred to her abuser as 'X' and said the abuse went on for two-and-a-half years.

345.title: 2019 WC final scene recreated as ball deflects off Stokes' bat in Lord's Test, video viral
345.article_body: A video went viral showing the ball deflecting off Ben Stokes' bat at non-striker's end in Lord's Test against New Zealand, with Joe Root imitating Stokes' hands-up reaction from the 2019 World Cup final. Notably, during the 2019 World Cup final, a throw had deflected off Stokes' bat and raced towards boundary when England needed nine runs to win.

346.title: Lego 'freezes' ops in some Russian stores after supply gets hit due to sanctions
346.article_body: Toymaker Lego's Russian reseller has said it is temporarily "freezing" operations at some of its stores in the country after the sanctions imposed on Moscow impacted its supply network. In March, Lego paused shipments to Russia due to disruptions caused by the Ukraine war. The company has 81 stores in Russia, which are operated by Inventive Retail Group.

347.title: Took me 8yrs to get my first Best Actress award: Kriti on IIFA win
347.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon celebrated her IIFA Best Actress award by posting a series of pictures on Instagram, writing, "Dreams do come true...It's taken me 8yrs to get my first #BestActress award." Kriti won the award for 2021 film 'Mimi'. She further wrote, "Will always be grateful to Dinesh Vijan [and] Laxman Utekar sir for making me your Mimi for life."

348.title: We still back ourselves to take 10 wickets vs England: NZ's Daryl
348.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Daryl Mitchell, speaking about the ongoing Test match against England, has said, "We still back ourselves to take 10 wickets." "We'll show up tomorrow morning now with the chance to open up an end and get stuck into their bowlers," he stated. Ahead of Day 4, England need 61 runs to win the match.

349.title: 'Vikram' becomes Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide
349.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark globally within two days of its release. It has become the third film to cross the ₹100-crore mark globally in Haasan's career after 'Dasavatharam' and 'Vishwaroopam'. The film, which also stars Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Suriya, has been directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj.

350.title: Michael B Jordan, Lori Harvey break up after over 1 year of dating: Reports
