350.article_body: Actor Michael B Jordan and model Lori Harvey have broken up after dating for more than a year, as per reports. "Michael and Lori are both completely heartbroken," PEOPLE quoted a source as saying. The couple had celebrated their one-year anniversary in November 2021, months after Jordan made their relationship Instagram official that January.

351.title: IFS officer shares questions from UPSC Preliminary exam, asks people to answer
351.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared pictures of questions from UPSC Civil Services Prelim exam and asked people to answer them. What is greenwashing, what is Miyawaki method and which crop is source of methane were among some of the questions shared by Kaswan. He also shared a question which was based on wildlife protection.

352.title: Use brass bottle, wooden brush: Shraddha on World Environment Day
352.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor said everyone should take a pledge to go green and preserve the environment on World Environment Day. She further said we owe a future full of green trees to future generations. "[Use] a brass water bottle instead of a plastic one, a bucket with a mug or a wooden toothbrush instead of a plastic one," Shraddha added.

353.title: 27-yr-old man arrested for stalking ex-classmate in Mumbai: Police
353.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested from Mumbai's Khar earlier this week for stalking a woman, police officials said. The woman told the police that the man, who was the woman's classmate in college, had stalked her since 2014. However, the woman filed an FIR against the accused after he approached her twice and even forcibly hugged her last month.

354.title: BJP leader Hans Raj Hans meets Moosewala’s family in Mansa district
354.article_body: BJP leader Hans Raj Hans met the family members of late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala in Mansa district on Sunday. "I have not come here for any political reasons, I have come here as an artist and as a father," Hans said. Moosewala’s parents met Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday in Chandigarh.

355.title: I'd be in Eng's camp because of old ball: Nasser on Day 4 of Lord's Test
355.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain, speaking about the Test match between England and New Zealand, said it has been a new-ball pitch and both teams have struggled against the new ball. He added England will face the old ball on Day 4. "I'd rather be in England's camp because of...old ball, but New Zealand..will be...fighting hard until...last run," he stated.

356.title: Female tennis players should get more prime-time slots: Billie Jean King
356.article_body: Former women's tennis player Billie Jean King has advocated for more prime-time slots for women's tennis in order for the game to get a better audience. "It will stay that way if we don't have more matches (at night)," King said. Notably, only one out of the 10 night matches at this year's French Open was a women's match.

357.title: El Salvador's Arevalo 1st Central American player to win Grand Slam in Paris
357.article_body: El Salvador's Marcelo Arevalo became Central America's first Grand Slam champion on Saturday when he teamed with Netherlands' Jean-Julien Rojer to win French Open men's doubles title. The 12th seeds saved three match points before beating Ivan Dodig and Austin Krajicek 6-7(4-7), 7-6(7-5), 6-3. Notably, the 40-year-old Rojer became the oldest Grand Slam doubles champion in Open Era history.

358.title: B'luru's Baiyappanahalli train terminal to start operations on June 6
358.article_body: Trains will start plying from Baiyappanahalli railway terminal, which is Bengaluru's first fully air-conditioned terminal, from June 6 onwards. It's named after Bharat Ratna recipient Sir M Visvesvaraya and will have seven platforms along with waiting halls, food court, VIP lounge and digital real-time passenger information system. It'll cater to 50,000 passengers commuting in 50 different trains.

359.title: Enough of high-level meetings, Kashmir wants action: Kejriwal
359.article_body: Following targeted killings in Kashmir, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that the era of 1990 has come again. "Whenever there is a murder in the Valley, news comes that the Home Minister has called a high-level meeting, enough of these meetings, now we need action, Kashmir wants action," Kejriwal added. "They (government) don't have any plans," he stated.

360.title: UP farmer falsely framed for 'cow slaughter'; policeman suspended
360.article_body: A 32-year-old farmer, Nawab Ali, in UP's Moradabad was booked and arrested for allegedly taking a cow for slaughter. However, he was released by a court after no evidence was found against him. His wife, Rabia Khatoon, said the police falsely framed him in the case. Sub-inspector Subhash Chandra, who filed the FIR against the man, has been suspended.

361.title: Fire breaks out at Jammu police station, several seized vehicles gutted
361.article_body: At least seven cars and over a dozen two-wheelers seized by police were burnt after a fire broke out on the Satwari police station premises in Jammu on Sunday, officials said. The fire broke out in an open area housing the vehicles after an overhead power line snapped, they added. Four fire engines were rushed to the spot.

362.title: Beer prices surge to £8 per pint for the first time ever in London
362.article_body: The price of a pint of beer has reached £8 (about ₹775) for the first time ever in London amid rising inflation, according to research from industry tracker CGA. Meanwhile, the average price of a pint of beer in UK has increased to £3.95. Beer prices in UK have risen over 70% since the financial crisis of 2008, CGA said.

363.title: Explosion that killed 13 at factory in UP's Hapur caught on CCTV
363.article_body: The explosion at a chemical factory in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur, that killed 13 people, has been captured on a CCTV camera. The footage shows objects flying in the air following the explosion. Smoke and dust were seen filling the air, which reduced the visibility of the surrounding area. At least 20 other persons have sustained injuries in the incident.

364.title: Want Kohli to break Tendulkar's centuries record: Rohit Sharma's coach
364.article_body: Rohit Sharma's childhood coach Dinesh Lad called Virat Kohli a "wonderful batsman" and added that Kohli will make a "strong comeback". "I think it's more about mental strength rather than form. Kohli should concentrate on that. Rest he'll bat well, we can't talk much about that. I want him to break Sachin Tendulkar's century record," he added.

365.title: Actors Prabhas, Yash attend 'KGF' director's b'day party, pics go viral
365.article_body: Actors Prabhas and Yash attended filmmaker Prashanth Neel's birthday party. The pictures of the duo from the party have gone viral on social media. "These are the moments to remember forever," a Twitter user wrote. "Bosses together," another user wrote. Prashanth, who directed Yash's 'KGF' franchise, will direct Prabhas in his upcoming film 'Salaar'.

366.title: People from outside not responsible for Delhi's pollution: Gopal Rai
366.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Sunday said that people from outside "are not responsible for the pollution problem in Delhi" and that Delhi's residents need to cut down their own share of pollution. Delhi government is taking all steps it can to protect the environment but "there's a need to do more", he said and added, "We can improve."

367.title: Maha Metro completes excavation of 12 km tunnel in Pune in 9 months
367.article_body: Maha Metro on Saturday completed the excavation of a 12 km underground tunnel between Swargate and Budhwar Peth in Pune after work began nearly nine months ago. "Due to the technical expertise and sound project management, the tunnelling work has been completed without any hindrance," a metro official said. Pune Metro Rail also shared pictures of the breakthrough on Twitter.

368.title: Supporter prepares 111-ft cake on UP CM Yogi's 50th birthday
368.article_body: A supporter of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Bareilly has prepared a 111-feet cake for his 50th birthday. The cake will weigh 40 quintals and it'll be mounted in phases and supported by 150 quintals of iron structure. The man, Amir Zaidi, will attempt to create a world record with the cake, which will be called 'cake of peace'.

369.title: Kagiso Rabada is a very big threat for Team India in SA T20Is: Irfan
369.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has termed SA pacer Kagiso Rabada as a "very big threat" for Team India in their upcoming T20I series against the Temba Bavuma-led side. "Rabada has regained the form he had lost a little. He is an extremely quality bowler...You can use him like Bumrah is used by the Indian team," added Irfan.

370.title: Won't quit Cong, up to them to throw me out: Sunil Jakhar's nephew
370.article_body: BJP leader Sunil Jakhar's nephew and Congress MLA Sandeep Jakhar has said that he'll not resign from his post and if Congress wants to "throw [him] out, it's up to them". This comes after Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring told Sunil to make Sandeep quit as MLA and join BJP. The remark shows Congress leadership's "arrogance", Sandeep added.

371.title: CEC Rajiv Kumar treks 18 km to remote polling booths in U'khand
371.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar trekked for 18 kilometres on Friday to the remote polling booths of Uttarakhand to assess the challenges faced by polling parties in hilly areas. Kumar visited Dhumak and Kalgoth, the most remote polling booths of Uttarakhand located in Chamoli. "Polling parties have to walk three days to reach here," Kumar said.

372.title: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis tests COVID-19 positive
372.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday tested positive for coronavirus. "Taking medication and treatment as per doctor's advice," Fadnavis said in a tweet, adding that he is currently under home isolation. "Those who have come in contact with me are advised to get COVID-19 tests done," he further said.

373.title: Putin holds festival honouring rumoured girlfriend Alina amid war, video released
373.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin reportedly held a gymnastic festival honouring his rumoured girlfriend and gymnast Alina Kabaeva, amid the Russian war on Ukraine. The 'Alina Festival', which was reportedly held last month, was aired on Russian state TV on June 1. The broadcast showed young children and gymnasts performing choreographed routines on stage at the festival.

374.title: I'm going to court: Pak singer on Karan Johar's 'Nach Punjaban' song
374.article_body: Pakistani singer Abrar Ul Haq posted a video on Twitter on Saturday saying that he will sue Karan Johar and T-Series for allegedly stealing his song 'Nach Punjaban' for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. Abrar said merely giving credit is not enough as he never sold his song. "It belongs to me and I'll get it back...I'm coming to the court," he added.

375.title: We denounce insult of religious personalities: BJP after its leader's remarks on Prophet
375.article_body: After violence broke out in Uttar Pradesh over BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, the party released a statement saying, "BJP strongly denounces insult of any religious personalities of any religion." "The BJP is also strongly against any ideology which insults or demeans any sect or religion. The BJP does not promote such people or philosophy," it added.

376.title: I don't party as I sleep by 11 pm, people think I'm uncool: Esha Gupta
376.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta said in an interview that people think she's "uncool" because she doesn't go to parties and sleep by 11 pm. "I'm one of those whose priority isn't partying...I want to wake up early," she added. Esha also spoke about her growth in the industry and said, "It has taken...time to reach where I am as a person."

377.title: Family of brain-dead girl donates heart, saves 14-yr-old Pune boy's life
377.article_body: The family members of a 14-year-old brain-dead girl donated her heart to a boy of the same age suffering from a severe cardiac condition, thereby saving his life. The transplant surgery was carried out at Pune's Army Institute of Cardio-Thoracic Sciences (AICTS). A green corridor was established for seamless transport of the donor's heart to AICTS within 11 minutes.

378.title: Death toll rises to 13 in UP's Hapur factory blast; 2 booked for culpable homicide
378.article_body: The death toll in factory blast in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur has increased to 13. The owner and director of the factory have been booked for culpable homicide. Police said 33 people were working inside the factory and 20 people who survived have sustained injuries. Police added that what material exploded will be clear after FSL report.

379.title: Dynamic CM: PM Modi on UP CM Yogi Adityanath's 50th birthday
379.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday wished UP CM Yogi Adityanath on his 50th birthday and called him a "dynamic CM". "Under his able leadership, the state has scaled new heights of progress. He has ensured pro-people governance to the people of the state," PM Modi tweeted. "Praying for his long and healthy life in service of the people," he added.

380.title: Shiv Sena to put up MLAs at Mumbai hotel ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
380.article_body: In a bid to avoid poaching, Shiv Sena has asked all its MLAs to stay at a hotel in Mumbai ahead of the Rajya Sabha elections, which will conclude on June 10. The decision was taken "as a precautionary measure", a senior party leader said. "They have been told to come to Mumbai on June 8," the leader added.

381.title: We made an honest film, India has embraced it: Producer Mahesh Babu on Major
381.article_body: Mahesh Babu, who has produced Adivi Sesh-starrer film 'Major', wrote on Twitter, "Thank you for the overwhelming response to #Major." "We made an honest film and India has embraced it...A must watch for every Indian," he added. 'Major' is based on the life of NSG commando Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, who was martyred in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

382.title: Have to love Trump's branding: Ashneer on 'Biden did that' sticker at US petrol pump
382.article_body: BharatPe's former Managing Director Ashneer Grover took to Twitter to share a picture of 'Biden did that' sticker featuring former US President Donald Trump at a petrol pump in the US. Grover wrote, "Politics is same everywhere...here in US Trump is savvy sticking these things at petrol pumps." He further said, "Have to love Trump's branding."

383.title: Warner, Finch are back, it means I probably won't start: Head on SL ODIs
383.article_body: Australia batter Travis Head has said he probably won't start in their upcoming ODI series against Sri Lanka as David Warner and Aaron Finch are also in the squad. "[We've] also got a middle-order that's so set in that...it's a hard one to get into," he added. Australia will play three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests in Sri Lanka.

384.title: India achieved 10% ethanol blending in petrol target 5 months before deadline: PM
384.article_body: On World Environment Day, PM Narendra Modi announced that India has achieved the target of 10% ethanol blending in petrol five months before the deadline. He added that it has also reduced carbon emissions by 27 lakh tonnes. The ethanol blending programme is aimed at reducing the country's dependence on crude oil imports, cutting carbon emissions and boosting farmers' incomes.

385.title: Akshay's 'Samrat Prithviraj' sends out message India needs: RSS chief
385.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat attended the special screening of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj'. Speaking about the film, he said, "It is a fact-based movie and rightly sends out the message the country needs today." "We used to read our history written by others. Now, we're looking at history from India's perspective," he added. The film also features Manushi Chhillar.

386.title: 13 cabinet ministers, 8 state ministers take oath in Odisha cabinet reshuffle
386.article_body: As part of cabinet reshuffle in Odisha, 13 cabinet ministers and 8 ministers with independent charge took oath on Sunday in Bhubaneswar in presence of state Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik. BJD MLAs Jagannath Saraka, Niranjan Pujari and R P Swain were among 13 MLAs who were administered oath. Meanwhile, three women legislators have been inducted into cabinet.

387.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Samrat Prithviraj' earns ₹23.3 crore in two days
387.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj has earned ₹23.3 crore in its first two days of release. While the film had grossed ₹10.7 crore on Friday, it collected ₹12.6 crore on Saturday. The film, written and directed by Chandraprakash Dwivedi, is based on the life and times of Rajput emperor Prithviraj Chauhan.

388.title: Our anti-aircraft systems are crunching enemy arms like nuts: Putin
388.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said during an interview that the country's anti-aircraft systems are "crunching" enemy weapons "like nuts" and that "dozens have been destroyed". The statement was first reported by the state news agency RIA. This comes as Russia claimed that it had shot down a Ukrainian plane carrying weapons and also struck a "foreign mercenaries" outpost near Odesa.

389.title: SRK graduated from same school: Naukri.com Founder as he shares his school certificate
389.article_body: Naukri.com Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani took to Twitter to share a photo of his character certificate from St Columba's School in New Delhi, dated June 8, 1981. The certificate stated he was "punctual in attendance and diligent in studies". He later went on to reveal that four years later,  actor Shah Rukh Khan too graduated from the same school.

390.title: Sunil Jakhar should make nephew quit as MLA, join BJP: Punjab Cong chief
390.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring told Indian Express that if BJP leader Sunil Jakhar feels that he is a "big and popular leader", then he should make his nephew and Congress MLA Sandeep Jakhar quit his post and join BJP. However, Warring claimed that Sunil would not do so because he knows that "Sandeep will lose the bypoll".

391.title: BJP leader shares video, claims MLA's son involved in case of minor's gangrape in Hyd
391.article_body: BJP MLA M Raghunandan Rao has shared a video alleging that an AIMIM MLA's son is involved in the case of a minor's gangrape in Hyderabad. Police had said that the MLA's son was not present at the time of the alleged crime. Meanwhile, Inspector S Rajashekhar Reddy said four accused have been arrested while the fifth accused is absconding.

392.title: I want to say something to Ukraine, stay strong: Swiatek after French Open win
392.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek gave a message to war-hit Ukraine in her on-court interview after winning the French Open title. "I want to say something to Ukraine. Stay strong, the world is still there," she stated. The 21-year-old Polish tennis player defeated 18-year-old Coco Gauff in the final with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-3.

393.title: Those protesting against mining should first stop using AC: Chhattisgarh CM
393.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said those who are trying to politicise mining issue should first stop using electricity and air-conditioner, fan and cooler and then fight for the cause. "Those who are protesting...should first switch off power at their house," he said, adding, "People are claiming 8 lakh trees will be cut...only 8,000 trees will be cut this year."

394.title: Colombian Prez faces house arrest for failing to save national park
394.article_body: A Colombian court sentenced President Ivan Duque to five days' house arrest and imposed a fine of around $4,000 for failing to comply with a Supreme Court order to protect a national park. Duque was held guilty of contempt of court for not taking measures to protect the Los Nevados National Park. He called the order unconstitutional.

395.title: Karthik has to perform against SA to remain in contention for T20 WC: Ravi
395.article_body: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has said that wicket-keeper batter Dinesh Karthik has to perform in his comeback series against South Africa in order to remain in contention for a spot in this year's T20 World Cup. "This is his (Karthik) opportunity...when he gets an opportunity in these games, he has to do it with India colours on," Shastri said.

396.title: Philippines sounds alert after restive volcano spews cloud of ash
396.article_body: The Philippines sounded an alert after a restive volcano at Mount Bulusan spewed a cloud of ash about 1 km into the sky on Sunday. The alert level was raised from zero to one on a five-point scale. According to the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology, 77 volcanic earthquakes were recorded in a 24-hour period before the eruption.

397.title: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur tests positive for COVID-19: Report
397.article_body: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur has reportedly tested positive for COVID-19 and has mild symptoms. According to a report by ETimes, the trailer launch event of his upcoming film 'Om: The Battle Within' has been rescheduled after the actor contracted the virus. The film is scheduled to release on July 1. Earlier, Kartik Aaryan also tested positive for COVID-19.

398.title: Miandad said 'Why are you looking at Audi? You won't get it': Shastri on 1985 WCC final
398.article_body: Recalling 1985 WCC final against Pakistan, Ravi Shastri revealed when India required 15-20 runs to win, Javed Miandad taunted him while he was looking at field setting. "Miandad said, 'Why are you looking at Audi? You aren't...getting it'," Shastri said. He added, "I told him, 'It's coming my way'." Shastri was awarded the car for being player of the tournament.

399.title: Ukraine's Kyiv rocked with multiple explosions, says mayor
399.article_body: Ukraine's Kyiv was rocked by multiple explosions, said Mayor Vitali Klitschko on Sunday. "Several explosions [occurred] in Darnytskyi and Dniprovskyi districts of the capital," Klitschko wrote on the Telegram app. "Services are already working on site. More detailed information - later," he added. This comes a day after Ukraine claimed to have recaptured parts of the Sievierodonetsk city.

400.title: I'm scrambling to get something: Candidate whose job offer Coinbase revoked
400.article_body: Coinbase on Friday extended its hiring freeze and also revoked some accepted job offers. One such candidate, a college graduate, who was supposed to join the company in September, said, "Now I'm scrambling to get something and most companies are either filled up or have frozen hiring." The candidate had passed on three job offers to work for Coinbase.

401.title: Nayanthara, Vignesh meet TN CM Stalin; invite him to their wedding
401.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and director Vignesh Shivan met Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin recently and invited him to their wedding. The duo will reportedly tie the knot on June 9 at a resort in Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu. "It will be low-key in presence of close friends and family members followed by a lavish wedding reception in Chennai," reports stated.

402.title: Lt Col booked for domestic violence in Ambala on complaint of officer wife
402.article_body: Police have booked a Lieutenant Colonel in Ambala for domestic violence and breach of trust on his wife's complaint. According to the complainant, an Army Major, after they got married, she discovered that contrary to his claims, his mother was alive and he had a widowed sister. She also accused him of dowry harassment and beating up their two children.

403.title: Over 12,000 MGNREGA workers resign en masse in Chhattisgarh
403.article_body: Over 12,000 contractual workers of the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) scheme resigned en masse on Saturday in Chhattisgarh. The decision was taken after the state government suddenly terminated the services of 21 MGNREGA  assistant project officers and over the workers' demands, an MGNREGA workers' union leader said. MGNREGA workers were on strike since April.

404.title: Actor Ahan Shetty, son of Suniel Shetty, wins Best Debut Male at IIFA 2022
404.article_body: Actor Ahan Shetty, son of Suniel Shetty, won the Best Debut Male award at the International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA) 2022. He won the award for his performance in Milan Luthria's 'Tadap'. Meanwhile, the Best Debut Female award went to Sharvari Wagh for the film 'Bunty Aur Babli 2'. IIFA was held in Abu Dhabi on June 4.
